I'm delighted to hear that your family had a great time and was able to take advantage of the beautiful weather by taking a trip out onto the beach. We certainly look forward to having you with us again for another family trip!   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for a one night honeymoon, and were blown away by the guest service. We could only afford a village view room (even that was pricey for us), but when we checked in the front desk staff kindly upgraded us to room 203 with an ocean view and balcony. They knew it was a special occasion, so when we got to our room their was champagne, fruit, and truffles waiting for us. How thoughtful!! There is complimentary wine tasting on the rooftop lounge from 5-6, which we enjoyed, what a view! Later we were enjoying the views from our balcony unexpected "sleepytime" tea was brought to our room as well! We couldn't have been happier with our experience, we felt like royalty, the room was absolutely perfect, the wifi was great, and we could spend forever taking in the
Manager Response: Dear Chanelle_Hope,   I'm so happy to hear that you were blown away by the service! Also, congratulations again on your union! We're always so excited to share in the special moments with our guests and do our best to help make those moments everlasting. We aren't always able to upgrade our guests but are always willing to do so for occasions like yours and when we have the availability. I'm glad that it all worked out for you on your first visit with us. Thank you for sharing your experience. We all look forward to your next stay with us.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: We stayed here for two nights for part of our honeymoon and couldn't recommend it enough. The staff were lovely and gave us a bottle of fizz to congratulate us. We were also able to check in a bit early too as our room was available. The pool and hot tub were excellent and the hotel is so close to the beach. The rooms were lovely and clean and the 5pm wine tasting was an excellent treat! You pay for parking there and a resort fee, but all worth it - would come back again!
Manager Response: Dear Emmas0701,   Congratulations again! Thank you for this amazing review. I'm glad you enjoyed your stay and the services we provided to you. I hope your visit to Laguna Beach was everything you hoped it would be and more. Since this was a honeymoon trip I can trust that you'll be with us for your first anniversary as well? You definitely need to make this an annual trip :). See you next year!  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: This is a great location, right on the sand at Main Beach, Laguna Beach.  Although this is an older hotel, there was recent renovations so everything was new, clean, modern.  The staff was very helpful and friendly, so hotel service was strong.  We had an ocean view room on the fourth floor with an amazing view.  The room was small, but comfortable for a couple of nights stay.  There was a very small balcony that barely fit 2 chairs and a table, but it was a nice place to sit and people watch or have coffee in the morning.  The reason that I gave this hotel an average rating, is that for the $$$, not having amenities and services that are typical in a hotel was discouraging.  I will start with no restaurant.  No bar.  No way to get any food or beverage on site.  If we came back
Manager Response: Dear KareBear,   I appreciate you taking the time to write a detailed review on your most recent stay with us. I'm thrilled to see that you had a pretty wonderful experience during your stay. I can understand how you felt the value of your stay, however, was diminished by the fact that we didn't have an on-site restaurant to enjoy some food and drinks. We hope to remedy this some time and are actively looking for ways to offer food in-house short of opening a restaurant. We have an on-site bar that's exclusively for our guests open Wednesday through Sunday during the afternoon and evening hours. Our mini-bars in each room also carry a variety of beverages and snacks available for purchase. We take feedback very seriously and use it to improve our products and services so again thank you! I'm sure you'll find better value in your next stay with us.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary Heading: Classy Bachelorette at the Inn at Laguna
Summary: We had thirteen women staying at the Inn for our friend's bachelorette weekend and the staff and facilities were amazing. We did have some festivities in our suite at one point and received noise complaints, but the staff was always polite and respectful. We were overall a pretty tame bunch, and the staff made it clear that they were following up on a complaint in the obligatory fashion but that our disruption wasn't really that bad, which we appreciated. The location can't be beat, the views are phenomenal, the beds are extremely comfortable, and the staff is welcoming and warm. THANK YOU INN AT LAGUNA!
Manager Response: Dear JessicaYasBarker,   I really appreciate your kind review. It's wonderful to hear that the bachelorette party was a success and that despite the couple noise complaints you were all still having a great time. Also, thank you all for being understanding of the noise complaints. It means a great deal to us and to our other guests that noise ceases after 10pm. Perhaps we'll see you all again after or during the wedding if you all decide to come out this way to celebrate. Again, thank you for your kind review.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: The Inn is right on the beach. My room had a nice size balcony with a stunning ocean view. We were there on business and our conference room also had an ocean view (you can imagine how much work was done !). Food was excellent, happy hour had free wine on the top deck overlooking, yes, again the ocean !!! Room was large, clean, had robes and slippers provided. Really nice staff and super location. Just a short walk to lots of restaurants. Awesome.
Manager Response: Dear Chris M,   'Awesome' just about sums it up doesn't it? I imagine you folks didn't get too much done with the distraction of the beautiful scene just outside your conference room but I hope you all still were productive and had a great time. I hope the next time you come to stay at our lovely hotel it's for your own leisure so you can get out onto the beach! Until next time...  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: This pretty stucco hotel is right on the beach, with an elevated position on the north end of Laguna's Main Beach. It's a fairly low key hotel. Not a lot of staff, no concierge, and simple, smallish rooms. Our room had a balcony with an incredible view of the Pacific and the beach -- with an incredible price to match. Room rates are comparable to the much fancier Montage, which has far more amenities. The attraction to this hotel is its beachy feel and serenity. One quibble I have is with their $15 daily resort fee. That's generally charged when there's a spa and/or fitness center -- in other words amenities worth paying extra for. The hotel does have a small pool but nothing else. When I asked about the amenities charge I was told it was for the "free" coffee and tea. Setting
Manager Response: Dear davemh333,  Thank you for taking the time to leave some feedback. I would just like to touch on the resort fee a bit and clarify the amenities covered in the resort fee. Our resort fee covers a host of amenities including the coffee and tea in the mornings, wine hour hosted from 5 - 6pm, beach equipment, wireless internet, cookies and milk in the evenings and access to the pool and jacuzzi. I'm so sorry if all of this information wasn't given to you at check-in. We strive to ensure this information gets passed on to each guest and it appears we were a bit absent-minded and forgot to tell you about all of the offerings so again, I'm sorry.  I do like your idea for complimentary bottled water and we may look into adopting that as one of our amenities especially going into our Summer months where water is like gold in these parts as it can get pretty hot out. Thank you again for taking the time to leave a review. We look forward to your next stay.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary Heading: Fantastic Location and Laid Back Southern California Charm
Summary: We had just a few days to spend at Laguna Beach and decided to splurge and stay right on the beach.  It was very expensive at over $700 per night all in, but the location is pretty unique.  I'm sure the fact that it was over Memorial Day weekend drove the cost up.  There is no better location in Laguna Beach.  Get a balcony or ocean view room where you can gaze at the ocean and watch all the activity on the city beach.  And all the interesting shops and restaurants are just a short walk away.  The room itself is nice but nothing outstanding.  One big drawback was that they booked a wedding that totally occupied the hotel's rooftop deck for one entire day and evening.  The rooftop deck is one if the best features of the hotel, yet it was off limits for an entire day with no real
Manager Response: Dear Mike S,   Thank you so much for your feedback. Our terrace is definitely a key feature of the hotel as it allows our guests to gather and mingle. I'm sorry that this wasn't available for you during your short time here. Thanks to your honest feedback, we'll definitely work towards informing our guests of any closures to the terrace ahead of time moving forward. Although there aren't really any substitutes for our rooftop terrace, there are some alternatives in town that are lovely in their own respect that we like to recommend. Again, thank you for your feedback. I hope to see you again for another visit and of course if there's anything you need or are wondering you can always reach out to us. Until next time...  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: We were on the way down to Del Mar for my President's Club trip and came out a couple days early to see friends.  Wanted to be right in the middle of Laguna Beach and found The Inn through tripadvisor reviews.  This Hotel is very nice and very updated.  Very clean with nice amenities.  We walked everywhere.  Exactly what we were looking for.
Manager Response: Dear Todd B,   "Exactly what we were looking for." is exactly what we like to hear! Our location and services make our hotel the prime place to be if you're looking to spend a few days channeling some inner peace and tranquility. We do our best to make everything easy for our guests so that all they need to worry about is where to go next. I'm so thankful that you chose to stay with us and hope that you find yourself here again soon.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: We love this little gem in Laguna Beach!  The location is wonderful for walking and enjoying the beach, the shops and the restaurants.  There are no loungers or bar service on the beach so we like to request  an ocean front room with a balcony to enjoy the sun.  There is also no restaurant within the property but they do supply coffee in the mornings in the lobby and milk and cookies in the evening. Las Brisas Restaurant is lovely and only a short scenic walk along the ocean side walkway. We also enjoy the beautiful view and a glass of wine on the rooftop terrace.  We will be back again and again.
Manager Response: Dear CariCanadian,   I truly appreciate the wonderful review! You've hit the main points that make our hotel so great. I'm pleased to hear that your stay was enjoyable and that you really took advantage of the balcony room that you booked to soak up the sun and enjoy some cocktails. Did you know that although we don't have a restaurant, there's a delivery service available in Laguna Beach similar to Uber eats that's great and affordable? Next time you come to visit be sure to ask about this service. Our guest service agents would all be happy to tell you all about this service and recommend some fabulous restaurants in town that you can order from. I hope to see you again here for another visit in the near future.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary Heading: Always a great experience here with excellent customer service.
Summary: My wife and I have stayed here a number of times and have never been disappointed, this time was no different. Upon early arrival, we were quickly checked in and ready to enjoy our weekend at Laguna Beach. This hotel is located high on a bluff, so although there is sand and water nearby (within walking distance), it is about a 5 minute walk if you want to sit on the sand and / or enjoy the ocean.  Lower floors have less or no stairs whereas higher floors will have stairs to access the beach area.  We went with a village view as the time of year we were going (May) was questionable as far as the weather is concerned. As expected, early mornings were dark and cloudy, almost rainy however the afternoon sun soon cleared the sky to a clear blue.  On this trip we ended up in a
Manager Response: Dear nativecal,   Thank you so much for this amazing review about your recent stay. I'm absolutely joyed to know that despite being on the village side of the hotel, you still had a great stay and didn't experience any street-side noise as can sometimes be the case considering the main street in Laguna Beach is Pacific Coast Highway. Our windows do tend to mute the noise considerably and at night there's not too much traffic going in and out of Laguna Beach. During this time of year when families take vacations and enjoy their time in our lovely little beach city, it's true that there are children having a good time but we do keep a pretty strict no noise policy after 10pm to be courteous to all our resting guests. Of course being a frequent guest of ours, I'm sure you're already aware of all of this but I'm guessing this may be one of the factors that drives you to return to stay with us. Again, thank you for taking the time to leave such a wonderful review and thank you for being such an amazing guest. We look forward to your next stay with us.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: Incredible location for a getaway. My friend and I stayed on the 5th floor with a view of the Ocean and pool. The view was incredible! The rooms were great, beds extremely comfortable, and we had a nice balcony. There was a complimentary happy hour every day on the terrace overlooking the ocean, and the staff was amazing! The pool is adjacent to the beach so you can walk out and down a path to get there. The pool had towels on every chair with relaxing music playing. Only downside was no bathroom available at the pool.  Overall this was one of my favorite stays. The location can not be beat! I will be back!
Manager Response: Dear L0la88,   I like to think that our hotel is the perfect place for a much needed and often times much deserved R&R. I'm happy to see that you seem to think the same. Our team here at The Inn takes great pride in our services so on behalf of the team here at The Inn at Laguna Beach, I thank you for your kind words regarding our staff. I'm confident that your next stay with us will be just as impressive as your last. Until next time...  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: My girlfriend and I came here for a quick one-night get-a-way. It was fantastic! The location of the hotel is great, you can walk to various places to eat, and the room was great. We had an ocean view room which was exactly what we wanted. They don't do food at this hotel, but there are so many great options nearby that it wasn't an issue at all. I will for sure come back!
Manager Response: Dear 296marisay,   Thank you for your kind words. I'm delighted to hear that you and your girlfriend enjoyed your time here at The Inn. It is a bit unfortunate that we currently don't offer many food options outside of breakfast, however, just as you said - there are so many restaurants nearby that it's hardly an issue at all. We look forward to your next visit to our hotel and hope that this time you spend a couple more days to really take in everything Laguna Beach has to offer. See you next time.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: We like this place, the location, etc but the extra charges are a bit much.  $50 pet fee, $15 resort fee, $30 parking on top of a $300 room- and that was on a Hotels Tonight Village View room booking- so they don't reduce their rate or offer any complimentary upgrades with low occupancy.
Manager Response: Dear Katie W,   First off, I'm sorry for the late response. I'm glad that you took the time to share your thoughts. I understand that the additional charges were off-putting for you and I know that with booking sites such as Hotels Tonight these charges aren't always clear upon booking so to that I also apologize. Despite these charges, however, I'm happy to hear that you liked our hotel. I'm also hoping that you enjoyed your visit to Laguna Beach overall. We're always willing to assist anyone directly with bookings to clarify any additional charges so as to not be blindsided as it was in this case. The next time you decide to stay in Laguna Beach, I hope you stay with us again and please feel welcome to call us directly so we can work with you. We look forward to another opportunity to having you with us again.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: The Inn at Laguna Beach is a great hotel.  It has the best location, located on the cliff right next to the Main Beach.  Most of the rooms look right out at the beach though I had a poolside view.  The rooms are large and comfortable.  We found the staff to be very friendly and efficient.  It was nice that they lent you beach towels, chairs and umbrellas.  In the late afternoon they serve you free wine from the rooftop terrace.  Maybe best of all, once you arrive you do not need your car for the rest of your stay there.
Manager Response: Dear Russ G,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay. You've hit the main points that make our hotel so great right on the nail. I'm pleased to hear that your stay was enjoyable and that you really took advantage of not having to take your car out while you were here. I hope to see you again here for another visit in the near future.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: Relatively small hotel situated right on the beach and a very short walk to the town and all it's delightful restaurants. We stayed for 3 nights and on one day had an easy drive to LA to visit the Disney Park, so you could use this hotel as a base for a beach and theme park holiday. We had a room overlooking the sea on floor 4 - glad we didn't have a room one floor below because that would have led straight out to the small pool area. Wouldn't have had much privacy there and no sea view. Rooms ok, but opening/closing the sliding door separating the wash hand basins (which are in the room) and the shower/toilet might be a bit tricky if you had any problems using your hand. We liked the free wine on offer in the evenings between 5 and 6 on the rooftop bar and the very pleasant bar
Manager Response: Dear JohnLightwater,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay. I'm pleased to hear that you had an enjoyable stay. I say many times that our hotel is in the perfect location in Laguna Beach but I often forget that Laguna Beach itself is perfectly located in Orange County. As you mentioned, it was an easy drive over to Disneyland from our hotel and that can be said of many Orange County, LA county and SD county attractions. In fact, it's only a 1 - 2 hour drive to either San Diego or Los Angeles from Laguna Beach which gives many of our visitors the option to have a nice day trip to any one of the famous metropolitan cities and still have plenty of time to return to Laguna Beach and enjoy our little beach town just like you did. Again, thank you for your review and I truly hope you choose to stay with us again on your next visit to Laguna Beach. Until next time...  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary Heading: Enjoyable hotel in a great location with a beautiful view. Could make some minor tweaks to set themselves apart.
Summary: I stayed here for one night with my wife.  I will start with things that we really loved about the hotel.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The view was exceptional.  We really loved leaving the screen door open and listening to the waves.  We initially thought it might be too loud for sleeping but it ended up being the most peaceful rest we have experienced.  It was great waking up to that view and sound. The hotel had coffee in the morning and they used good quality beans from starbucks.  They did a wine hour in the evening but my wife and I did not partake as we are more into craft beer.  They also had cucumber water in the lobby at all times. Another nice touch was the hotel leaving a note in our room with chilled champagne and glasses to greet us.  Now to the things I
Manager Response: Dear aggie20031,  I really appreciate you leaving an honest detailed review of your stay. Your feedback is very important to us as it allows us to touch on areas that need improvement based on your observations so to that I thank you very much. To hear that you weren't offered any luggage assistance disappoints me greatly as this is not typical of us at all and I'm sorry this service wasn't extended to you - we'll absolutely be more diligent.  Also, although we do charge for late check out which gives you until 2pm, I think we can definitely work on some flexibility on this. Despite these minor hiccups I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay overall. I'm sure by the next time you come to stay with us we'll have made some great changes. We look forward to the next opportunity to see you here.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: I was here for a wedding and loved everything about the place.  The people are excellent in every way possible!  I arrived before my room was ready and the front desk held my bags, recommended the 4th floor bar, called me when my room was ready, brought my luggage to the room, and then hand delivered my keys to me in the bar.  At that point, I knew this was going to be a great weekend!
Manager Response: Dear Z1257WDpaulm,  I'm so glad that you mentioned how we handled your check-in because we aim to leave this very impression on folks with how we try to fully service the check-in process same as how you just explained. It delights me to no end to know that because of how we had taken care of everything you were able to fully enjoy your stay. I hope you come back out to visit again and if you do please don't hesitate to reach out to us so that we can personalize your stay. We look forward to your next stay.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: We've stayed at a number of hotels in the Laguna-Irvine area and the In at Laguna Beach is our favorite. The location is perfect, the rooms are clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. While the Inn is not as grand as some of the mega hotels in the area, it is one of the most comfortable and relaxing.
Manager Response: Dear Darryl O,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay. I'm so happy to hear that we're your favorite hotel in the Laguna-Irvine area. Out of all the options available in Laguna Beach for lodging, we are without a doubt the best hotel when it comes to location and service so thank you for noticing. We look forward to your next stay with us here at The Inn.   Warm regards,   Ernest

Summary Heading: Amazing stay at The Inn At Laguna Beach!
Summary: We traveled to California for my birthday trip and I wanted to introduce my sweetie to lovely Laguna Beach, my favorite city in Southern California. Well, he surprised me by booking a suite at The Inn with a spectacular ocean view room! The view was unbelievable and we had a corner room so you saw the ocean on 2 walls.  The staff had champagne waiting for us so we enjoyed a little bubbly on the balcony while we relaxed and watched the waves crashing before starting our evening.  We stayed at The Inn for 2 nights and next time we will extend the visit.   The Inn is perfected located near great shops, restaurants, art galleries and of course the Main beach! The lobby is quaint and bright and the staff very friendly and helpful. They recommended several cute places to us that were
Manager Response: Dear Daydreamer025,  Wow. You've said so many great things about us and I'm so happy to hear about how your sweetie set this up for you as a birthday surprise. I'm also absolutely thrilled to hear that we won you over and have become your new Laguna Beach home! We treat every guest like old friends but our return guests are like family so welcome to the family to you! Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We look forward to your next visit and the many more to come after that. When you're ready to book your next reservation, please mention to our reservations team that you're a returning guest.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: Best town in California. Laguna Beach. Best Hotel in Laguna Beach.. the Inn! located in the middle of everything, yet Right on the Beach! between the most gorgeous walking park and play beach. Best of everything.!!!
Manager Response: Dear kvaught7,  I couldn't agree with you more! Thank you for taking the time to leave some feedback. If you find yourself back in Laguna Beach, I'm sure we can count on seeing you again for another wonderful stay. We look forward to your next visit and hope that you have more opportunities to explore this beautiful little beach town.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: We stayed here as part of a tour of California in April and I will say that the location of the Hotel is AMAZING! We had an ocean view room and the view was stunning. The location was excellent as the beach, restaurants and bars we all within walking distance- Laguna itself is beautiful.  However.... This Hotel is very dated, the room smelt of damp and the bathroom was awful, the sink was in the main bedroom room next to the entrance and door, next to it was a small room not much bigger than a cloakroom with a toilet and sink. Carpet was very grubby and there was no light on the balcony. Over and above this, although the room was ocean view, it backed directly on to a busy road on the other side. We were woken up every morning with traffic noise.  I give this 3 stars purely for
Manager Response: Dear whywhywhy10,  Thank you for your review on your most recent stay with us at The Inn. I appreciate you sharing your honest feedback as this truly helps us improve our products and services. We'll definitely get to work on the things you mentioned and hope that you notice some changes on your next stay. We look forward to potentially having a second opportunity to make your next stay even better and hopefully earn a 5 star review from you. Until next time...  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary Heading: Great choice if you want something smaller and upscale
Summary: If you book The Inn at Laguna Beach, try to get oceanfront rooms - it is worth paying more for the spectacular views of Main Beach. We had two rooms facing the beach and spent four nights here. The Inn is not a huge resort with a lot of floors and restaurants, etc. It is an elegant, small-to-medium hotel that is clean and central to so many things you can do in Laguna Beach. The hotel is adjacent to Heisler Park - a popular oceanfront park with dramatic views of the beaches. Heisler Park (I reviewed this separately) is one of the first things you should do after checking in. The Inn is close to restaurants and shopping - all within walking distance along S Coast Highway and connecting streets. The hotel rooms weren't huge, but they were comfortable and clean. The hotel staff was
Manager Response: Dear doors64248,  Thank you for taking the time to leave such a detailed review of our hotel and the area! You seriously did a marvelous job at describing our hotel and services you must work in marketing. All joking aside, I'm sincerely happy that you had a great time staying with us in Laguna Beach. As you know, we're all happy to share what we know about the area so that you can take full advantage of Laguna Beach's offerings. When you come back to visit again please be sure to pick our brains on what's cool and fun to do in town. We can't wait to see you again!  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary Heading: Fabulous ocean front, rooms vary greatly
Summary: The ocean facing side of this hotel is wonderful and for the most part it is very clean, except for the elevators which have the filthiest carpets I've ever seen in a hotel and stank, particularly the elevator on the right when facing the two elevators.  We arrived early on a Sunday and gave our mobile phone numbers to reception so they could call us when our room was ready. We went for a walk in sunshine and had a drink and lunch at lovely restaurant a short distance away.  We received a call just a few minutes before the stated check in time and returned to put our bags in the room.  What an enormous disappointment!  There are a few rooms (I'm guessing four or five, possibly more) that face directly into the reception area parking lot.  Our room was literally two feet from the
Manager Response: Dear SFKAT3,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on your recent stay with us at The Inn at Laguna Beach. I'm disappointed to hear that you didn't quite enjoy your stay with us and I'm sorry that we seemed to have failed in making your stay as enjoyable as possible. It does appear that although we couldn't upgrade you to an ocean view room at no additional cost, we were at least able to get you a quieter room on a higher floor for your stay to which I'm happy we were able to do for you.   I'm not sure how you made your booking but for instances like yours we ask that you book directly with our hotel's reservations department because they can offer clear descriptions of all hotel rooms so that you can make a more informed decision on what to book. In addition to booking your reservation through our reservations department, giving us a call at the hotel before you arrive to make any requests is a great tip. Our ocean view rooms are our most premium room type and the rates are indeed higher than our village facing rooms for that reason. For our guests that prefer not to pay the higher rate, we have a beautiful terrace space on the fourth floor of our hotel that boasts dramatic views of the gorgeous Pacific and our guests can enjoy this space at their leisure.   I appreciate you giving us your honest feedback and I promise that we will work on the things you mentioned like our elevators. I hope that you give us another chance to impress you with another visit to our hotel. If you do decide to give us a second chance, please call us so that we can work with you on your reservation. I look forward to the opportunity to host your next visit in Laguna Beach.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: The Inn at Laguna Beach is an excellent place to visit. Beach, basketball, volleyball, restaurants are within walking distance. Very clean. Staff was very helpful and made stay easier. We had visitors which were able to stay for the day.
Manager Response: Dear Angel B,   Thank you for leaving some feedback on your most recent visit to Laguna Beach. I hope that you had a chance to jump on one of the courts you mentioned to show off your skills! If not, I'm sure you at least got to enjoy the beach and some of the many restaurants in walking distance to our hotel. I'm delighted to hear that our staff made your stay in Laguna Beach easy by helping you out with sharing our knowledge of the local area. Lastly, I just want to say that we absolutely love it when our guests invite guests of their own to enjoy the hotel and services so thank you for that as well! We look forward to your next visit!  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: Loved our stay here! Great location! Easy access to the beach, restaurants, shopping, and museums. Happy hour was outside, with an ocean view. Bartender even pointed out some whales!  Pool was great, too.
Manager Response: Dear Marta K,   Thank you for your review on your most recent stay. Your headline says it all; our location is absolutely THE BEST! Coupled with our services and our teams genuine friendliness, I don't think you'll find a better place in Laguna Beach to stay. I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and am especially happy that you got to see whales while on our terrace. It's not often that you get to see whales breaching out in the distance so that's a really nice treat. We hope that you have an even better stay with us on your next visit. We look forward to having you stay with us again.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: Had a beautiful view of the beach/ocean.  Too bad it rained and was dreary our WHOLE trip!   Complimentary Tea service sent to room at night, champagne sent to room upon arrival, daily wine hour, turn down service,etc.....luckily we weren't too bummed about being stuck in the room!    Great location to the best parts of town - able to walk anywhere we needed to be.  Very classy hotel and staff.  Will visit again!
Manager Response: Dear LisaTa0618,   Thank you for leaving a review on your recent stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach. Although I'm sure you would have preferred better weather, I'm happy to hear that you didn't let the rain dampen (pun intended) your stay at The Inn. Even on rainy days, the views of Laguna Beach are totally immaculate. I appreciate your positive attitude towards the weather and hope that you get warm sunny weather on your next visit to our hotel so that you can fully enjoy the beach which is just right outside our doors. Again, thank you for leaving a review and for choosing to stay with us here at The Inn. We look forward to your next visit.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary Heading: Still as glorious as the first time we visited!
Summary: This was our 2nd visit to The Inn at Laguna Beach. Once again, the service we received when we arrived was very welcoming. Peter assisted us and we were very thankful. Our room, with balcony, looked out to the ocean. You just can't beat the view and the sound of the waves! I saw whales too, which was a huge thrill. The Inn provides binoculars which came in handy!  The Inn is close to all shops and restaurants and is in the perfect location. The view from the rooftop, where happy hour is enjoyed, is wonderful. Fresh cookies in the evening are yummy!  We had the best time and will be back again!
Manager Response: Dear four2travel,   I'm so pleased to hear that your second visit to hotel was "glorious" as you say :). As you've come to find out, we take great pride in the service we provide and I thank you for taking notice. I'm also glad you got to see whales while you were here - it's not often that you can catch them breaching out there from the hotel so you were definitely blessed with a little show! We can't wait for your next visit and we hope you get another whale show as well. Until next time...  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: This hotel is in the perfect location and the staff was excellent.We really enjoyed it.The shopping was really convenient and lots of good restaurants all in walking distance.The pool and views were awesome.
Manager Response: Dear jvillard,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent visit to The Inn. I'm glad to hear you enjoyed your visit. You touched on all the major keys that sets our hotel apart from all the rest in Laguna Beach. When you stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach, everything you want to see, do and experience is only moments away! Again, thank you. We look forward to your next visit!  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: Stayed here a while ago but forgot to write a review. Very nice hotel right on the water. My family is from Laguna so it was a bit strange staying in a hotel but fun. Bed was so comfortable and everything was really nice. I wasn't on the waterfront side but still nice. Nothing to complain about. Underground parking was a plus because downtown Laguna is a nightmare to find parking. The staff was very friendly and not snooty at all. Sometimes staff at these swanky places can be a little stuffy, but nope, very friendly and accommodating. I'm a big fan of the Riviera, but this was fun too.
Manager Response: Dear Sweetie1971,  It really means a lot to us that you enjoyed your time at our hotel and that you chose to stay with us over the Riviera. I especially like your comment about our staff as it speaks volumes to the culture of our property. Our associates are all free to be their natural fun loving and friendly selves which gives our hotel that genuine warm welcoming feeling that I think every guest feels as they walk through our doors. Thank you so much for taking the time to leave feedback on your recent stay. We hope to see you again in the near future.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: The location was perfect. The hotel is directly on the beach and the view from oceanside is stunning. It's a short walk to the main shops and restaurants. If you've never been to Laguna Beach, don't expect to drive anywhere. Walking is the BEST way to get around because parking is atrocious as is the traffic (this has nothing to do with the hotel!).  For the price, I was expecting a bit more amenities like room service and a small gift shop of some kind. The hotel does not have this. In addition, the rooms are very small. The property you can tell is old (they all are) and the ventilation/hvac system is old and VERY LOUD. We had to shut the whole thing off to sleep. I prefer it to be dark when I sleep (blackout), but we had to throw a shirt over their bedside clock and the
Manager Response: Dear T5580HPcatherinep,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave such a detailed review on your stay. You touched on a lot of great things about our hotel and I can't thank you enough for sharing your thoughts. We've recognized that we lack a room service option so we've worked on providing some type of similar service and have found a local company that delivers food from any restaurant in and out of town - you can look forward to that on your next visit to our hotel.  As for the pet policy, you've made an excellent point so we're now telling our guests that so long as the dog is not alone late at night, they're allowed to be left in the room while our guests enjoy a day out.  Again, thank you so much for your feedback! We hope to see you again soon.   Warm regards,   Ernest

Summary: I was in Long Beach for a conference and booked a day at The Inn at Laguna Beach for a day of relaxation. I arrived early and was lucky to be able to check in early. I stayed in one of the King balcony rooms facing the ocean. The view was incredible and the room was very comfortable. I appreciated the nice touches like the complimentary wine. I enjoyed it on the balcony and then spent time on the beach during the afternoon. The coast is absolutely beautiful and this was the perfect spot to explore. I was happy to be able to order sushi to be delivered from a nearby restaurant and enjoyed relaxing in the room. I took advantage of the hottub which was vacant during my stay. My favorite part was the sunrise in the morning before I headed out. Wish I could have stayed longer! I'd
Manager Response: Dear Catherine,   Let me start by saying that you took some really beautiful pictures and I thank you for sharing them with us all. Reading your review and looking at your pictures it looks and sounds like you squeezed in so much in just your one day here and there's still so much more that Laguna Beach has to offer! You definitely need to come back to spend more (well deserved) relaxation time for yourself. The tranquil Laguna Beach scenes certainly inspired tranquil moments for you. We're excited for your return to Laguna Beach and can't wait for you to experience more of our lovely little town.  Warm regards,

Summary Heading: Amazing time with wonderful staff and beautiful and clean rooms.
Summary: Visited Laguna Beach and first time to stay here.  Lovely hotel in the midst of museums, restaurants and walking distance to galleries.  Love being right on the water.  Next time I'll book a room with an ocean view and balcony.
Manager Response: Dear Twincitydweller,  I appreciate your review and am happy that you enjoyed your first time here. As I've stated before in other reviews, our proximity to the many shops, restaurants, and galleries really sets us apart from the other hotel choices in Laguna Beach. We're proud to be located in the main heart of Laguna Beach and even more proud of the services we offer. We have no doubt that every one of your visits to our hotel will be just as wonderful as your first. Thank you for staying with us here at The Inn. We look forward to your next visit.   Warm regards,  Ernest E

Summary: Stayed one night on a Saturday.  Bright sunny place overlooking the ocean.  Great access to town, great restaurants and for beach walks and hikes in the hills.  Room was very nice with an balcony on which one can dine on take out or room service.  Leave sliding door open and you can hear the ocean going to sleep. Nice pool and hot tub overlooking the ocean.  Only 20-25 min from Orange County Airport.
Manager Response: Dear Daniel,  Thank you for your kind review! One of our greatest features is our proximity to all of the great shops, restaurants, and galleries that Laguna Beach has to offer. We're so happy to hear that you had a great time and enjoyed the views on your balcony with some food and drinks. Sounds like you had a perfect ending to your day with the sounds of the ocean waves crashing down on the beach to lull you asleep. We hope to see you again in the near future for another stay in beautiful Laguna Beach.  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary Heading: Ocean front boutique hotel, no gym and common areas a bit dated
Summary: This hotel has a great location if you get an ocean front room. Otherwise, you'll be looking out on a busy road. I arrived after Southern CA had gotten a ton of rain and the carpeting in my room in certain areas was really wet.  (The hallways are open to the outdoors.) I left a towel over it hoping housekeeping would address the next day but they didn't do anything about. I would have requested to switch rooms but I had already unpacked when I noticed the water and was only there for 3 nights.   The rooms were well decorated and spacious-- the balcony overlooking the ocean was great. My bathroom was a bit dated.  There's a foot path that goes right in front of the hotel which is great for runs/walks but also makes the hotel somewhat less private.   They also charge for parking
Manager Response: Dear MH2014747,   First off, we are happy you found the rooms well decorated and spacious and were able to enjoy our balconies with unimpeded views of the ocean. We definitely do hope you visit again, when we aren’t having record breaking rainstorms, so that you can fully enjoy everything Laguna Beach has to offer. On having some wet carpet due to the rain, please know you can call our front desk who are available 24 hours and would have been more than happy to get that issue resolved for you quickly. Overall, we are happy you’d return, but are sorry that the epic rains we experienced got in the way of an otherwise enjoyable stay. Please reach out to us directly when you decide to return and we’ll be happy to take care of you.  Warm regards,  Ernest

Summary: So we drove an hour from LAX to get here for our second stay, we feel it was worth passing up all the other hotels along the way after a late landing into LAX  This place is a pet friendly gem on the ocean and I suggest the ocean view rooms with balcony so you can sit and enjoy the ocean in the evenings and even better in the morning   Right across the street from artist shops and good food we really enjoy the laid back California style this place represents   Repeat customer
Manager Response: Dear Douglas8098,  Thank you for leaving a review on your recent stay with us.  We are thrilled that you enjoyed your time here and were able to take full advantage of your balcony and ocean view!  It's a long trek from LAX to Laguna Beach, so we really appreciate that you chose our hotel along the way, and were able to experience all the nearby shops and restaurants that make Laguna Beach so special.  We already can't wait to have you return!   All the best,   Ernest Esteban

Summary: Best hotel value in Laguna Beach. Ocean view rooms greet the waves of the ocean in your room and on your balcony. The staff is the finest staff we have ever encountered in all of our personal and business travels. They know you by name and provide the guests with a wonderful experience. Reasonably priced for a hotel on the ocean. Love the boutique hotel with only 73 rooms. Very friendly guests. Complimentary wine in the evening and good night cookies and tea. Complimentary Starbucks in the morning. Located on the north end of main beach. park on site and really rarely will you need a car as you can walk to restaurants and shopping. We will be back there again next year..
Manager Response: Dear Mr. and Mrs. Zoob,  It's been an absolute pleasure to have you here and meeting you both for the first time. We all appreciate your kind words about us and to hear that you had a lovely time at our hotel; it truly means a lot. We miss you both and can't wait to see you again next year. :)

Summary: Amazing location, right on the beach with amazing views and beautiful beach. Lots of restaurants and shops near by yet the hotel feel secluded (in a good way). Rooms are nice and comfortable. Feels very luxurious even though it is listed as a 3 star. Pool is nice with a great view.
Manager Response: Dear Rannoun,   Thank you for your review on your recent stay with us. I'm delighted to see that you enjoyed our hotel and amenities. Our proximity to the local restaurants, shops and galleries as well as the luxurious feel you get from our hotel like you mentioned is what sets us apart from the rest in Laguna Beach. Many have described our hotel as having an intimate/private feeling. I'm so happy that you've recognized all of this and hope that we get to see you again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Best view and best service ever!
Summary: My daughter and I had an amazing time in Laguna Beach and it all started with The Inn at Laguna Beach. Service was excellent and very friendly. We were upgraded to an ocean front room and let me tell you the view was stunning. Sleepy time evening tea magically appeared in our room every evening. Nice touch! Great trip! We will stay at The Inn again.
Manager Response: Dear Donnaruns,   Thank you for your fantastic review on our hotel. It fills my heart with joy to hear that you and your daughter had an amazing time in Laguna Beach in large part to the great start you had at our hotel. Being a small boutique hotel with only 70 rooms allows us to really focus on our guests on a personal level making sure that you all have the best experience possible in Laguna Beach. Again, thank you for your review. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This hotel is located next to the main beach in Laguna Beach.  It's a clean, beautiful property close to shops, restaurants and of course, the beach.  The rooms were lovely and comfortable, the staff was friendly ad helpful and we enjoyed the opportunity to meet other guests at morning coffee and during the evening social hour.
Manager Response: Dear C4019ZCthomasb,   Thank you so much for leaving a review on your recent stay with us at The Inn at Laguna Beach! It's wonderful to hear that you enjoyed mingling during our complimentary manager's wine hour up on our beautiful Pacific Terrace. Our boutique style hotel enables us and our guests to share a more personal relationship with each other. Again, I'm so happy that you enjoyed yourself and were able to meet some great people while you were here. We can't wait to see you again.   Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: Recently stayed here and had a room on the ocean side. We kept the sliding door open so we could hear the waves lull us to sleep. It was very clean and the staff was excellent. We would hang the "service needed" tag on the door and by the time we returned from breakfast. It was done.   Loved the milk and cookies that was available nightly in the lobby. We didn't partake of the nightly wine and cheese as we don't drink but it was well attended by the sound coming from the lobby each night.   You could order breakfast in your room or go to one of the restaurants nearby. No other room service available.   Close to the area of shops and galleries plus the path to Heisler Park was right outside the pool area.
Manager Response: Dear JVLD,   I would like to thank you for mentioning our excellent staff as a part of your positive experience during your stay. Aside from the obvious things that make our hotel outstanding like our close proximity to the restaurants and shops, we take pride in the service we provide our guests. I'm sorry we're unable to offer any late night room services, however, we've recently learned of a service in town that does restaurant/grocery delivery. We'll be happy to tell you all about this service on your next visit to our hotel. Until next time!  Warm regards,   Ernest E

Summary: I recently visited this hotel for a celebration and just had to write a review. Everything about this hotel is exceptional; the facility, the convenience of location( breathtaking views) , and the staff (professional. friendly & accommodating). In spite of the long flight from the northeast I would definitely return here for a vacation. I see no need to  leave the U.S. to vacation when there are awesome places like this to enjoy !! Paul O
Manager Response: none

Summary: The view was one in a million. This is my favorite beach view in California. We only stayed one night,I could have stayed longer. Maybe next time . We only had 1 problem The room we booked had no view . We face the pool with glass walls around it. It fell short of all the pic I saw.I thought I was booking a room with a view of the ocean not a view of a enclosed pool area. We had to go out side the hotel to see the ocean. Not happy about that .

Services were limited with no restroom or drinking water by the pool meaning children had annoying visits back to the room. Website and pictures promised so much more, so very underwhelmed by experience and feel I was very much overcharged here.  Great location and views from rooms but felt more like a 3 to 4 star hotel overall. Real shame as most of the reviews before we arrived read in a positive manner
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, close to Las Brisas (great restaurant), friendly & accommodating staff...., rooftop reception with the best view.  Thanks to the "wine fairy" who was always flying by to freshen up our glass!!  Parking:  Included with your stay & self parking.  Easy to come & go as you wish.  On Main Street but very quiet.  Easy access to the beach!  Would definitely stay here again!!  Only thing, not all rooms have bath tubs.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel location is ideal. Everything is within walking distance. The weather in Laguna Beach is outstanding even during the hot summer. Staff was very friendly. The room is clean and nice but the sink is in the room ...!! I understand that the hotel is pricey because it is located in an expensive area but not to this level! The ocean view is almost 60-70% more.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect Location When Seeing Pageant of  the Masters
Summary: The view from our room was fantastic. The room itself was lovely little bit small but beautiful view in nicely done. We had room service the first night which came from Las Brisas which was nextdoor. It was very good. The beach is right there. Hearing the ocean all night long was just great. Pokemon hunters were everywhere in the middle of the night when I looked out my window. They were well behaved it was just interesting.  My only suggestion to the management would be to be aware of what's going on at the pool. I observed a lovely couple trying to swim,but some screaming 10 to 12-year-old boys took over the pool. The man had to ask them to remove their belongings from his Chaise lounge several times. He and his wife were attempting to swim laps, but that was impossible with
Manager Response: none

Summary: Based on our recent 4 night stay in room 205 we are planning to return to this property twice next year.  Amazing retreat, amazing service, location, ambiance.  We have been to this property before but find it even better than our last stay.  We came to the Inn at Laguna almost directly from a 5 night stay at a 5 star Waldorf property in Key West Florida (5 star property but 4 star experience...see my trip advisor review on Casa Marina).  The Inn though is 5 stars in every imaginable way.  Tranquil yet close to the fine dining in Laguna Beach and the art and shops there.  Amazing staff, from roof top bar Stephanie (great wine happy hour nightly at 5) to management staff Mr. Ceyala and everyone in between. Not one thing to criticize or ask for improvement on.  Wonderful place,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location and even better staff!  Richard and Crystal made sure our room came with Priceless views!  Actually the views from the hotel terrace are wonderful as well, and the fact that you can walk to almost everything you'll need further enhances the experience.  Ok, I may have went overboard staying there 3 or 4 weekends in June, but I don't need a pinch, I lived it!  Looking forward to my next visit!  DCA - Scottsdale, AZ
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice spot and good team but too expensive for such level
Summary: We spent two nights and I have to say that the location is great, very nice view and direct on the ocean. The staff was also friendly and helpful.  But the rate we paid is for a five stars not three, and the standards are not the same at all. The worst Air conditioned system I never seen in an Hotel. We couldn't sleep both nights.  No Valet Paring, no bar, no restaurant, a poor breakfast. The sheets quality is low and many other things should be revised. The rate we paid was really double expensive for what we got.
Manager Response: Dear BusinessShipTrav,  I wanted to reach out to you personally to apologize that you did not have the five-star experience that I know we are capable of delivering. I am happy to see that you enjoyed the view, our great location and the service from the wonderful team here, but I am sorry that those pieces did not add up to an overall enjoyable stay. We do have a Terrace Bar 5 days a week, and we have a free wine reception every night. We also have wait staff available every day to deliver breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks to you in your room, by the pool or on the terrace. Also, I hope that you were able to let us know about any problems you were having with your AC during your visit, as we have round the clock maintenance available to address those issues. I truly apologize that we did not deliver on the value you expected. Your feedback means a lot to us and we appreciate you taking the time to share it.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: I was able to get upgraded to an Ocean View room, Beautiful hotel.  Only stayed one night, will have to go again.  Got to save up more money for next year.  Cliffs restaurant close by.  Excellent food.  It's pricey
Manager Response: Dear Ron,  Thank you so much for this wonderful five-star review and for being such a lovely guest. We truly hope you will come back next year and get a chance to have a longer visit with us. It would be our absolute pleasure.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location, beautiful views, friendly service, charming decor
Summary: My daughter and I spent a lovely 4 nights at this hotel. The views of Laguna Beach are gorgeous. Our room had a partial view without a balcony but you can still enjoy the view on the deck. The reception was friendly and welcoming, with warm cookies and milk served in the lobby every day. The rooms are very pretty and clean, and feel updated and fresh. My only critic would be that the sink is in the room, and that can be noisy if one person is sleeping....but there are so many pluses to the hotel so that is a minor issue. The mattress was very comfortable, and there is a coffee/tea maker in the room.  The hotel is located at the main beach in Laguna Beach, so no need for a car, we drove, but only took the car out to go down the Pacific Coast Hwy or to Irvine. You can walk to
Manager Response: Dear Desertsnow77,  It was such a delight to read about you and your daughter's visit with us and your time in our lovely town. I'm so happy the team here was friendly and welcoming, and we want you to know that we greatly appreciate these kind words, and this five-star review. Thank you for being our guest and we hope you will return and visit us again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Booked two nights at the Inn at LB based on TA ratings. Huge disappointment. Arrived 1:30 PM we were told our room was not ready. Returning from lunch at 3 PM still was not ready. Were then told checkin is at 4!  Finally in our room - it was already occupied by a couple enjoying drinks om their terrace. Our new room was smaller and had a less private terrace. What a joke. This hotel has great location and views of LB and ocean are great. Interior is fresh and new but very few people on staff. Those who are there are friendly but not the kind you would expect at places charging premium rates. We were given a big discount which was nice but does not really matter that much. Will for sure never return. Oh - by the way, the double rooms are so small you cannot even have suitcases
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location of this hotel is OK.  One of the reasons that I really enjoy it is because they allow my pup to stay for free.  I wish it were a bit closer to ocean, like the Pacific Edge where you can literally feel the spray of the ocean from your balcony. My husband and I have stayed here at least 5+ times. And every time we come back I never feel that I get the appropriate welcoming that one would offer a recurrent guest.  The hotel staff are a bit pretentious as well...  The last time we stayed here I was so fed up with the attitude that I do not think we will be returning.
Manager Response: Dear ReneeMV,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. It is important for us to know how it feels to be our guest, and in this case the ways in which we can improve. I am so sorry that our team did not make you feel special and welcome, which you absolutely are and deserve to be treated as such. I want to personally let you know, as the GM of the Inn at Laguna Beach, that I take this to heart and I want to make it right for you. Every guest is special, and considering you have stayed with us so many times I would really appreciate the opportunity to make this right for you. If you can give me and my team that chance, please send me an email at cgraves@theinnatlagunabeach.com and I will be happy to talk more. Thank you for the honest feedback and for being our guest.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Most beautiful and convenient location.  Staff is great.  Saltwater pool is nice but this location can't be beat.  They have a complimentary wine between 5 and 6 on a deck overlooking the entire Laguna coast - beautiful.  Everything is within walking distance - restaurants, shops even the Sawdust Festival and pageant of the Masters.
Manager Response: Dear dan9669,  Thank you so much for this review. I'm thrilled that the staff stood out and that you enjoyed our unbeatable location. We appreciate these kind words and hope that you will come back and visit us again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: We spent only one night - traveling down from Ventura for the Pageant of the Masters - and are glad we stayed at the Inn.   We arrived at 12:30p and thought we'd check in and then have lunch while we waited for a room. The desk staff seemed happy to see us and we were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was immediately available.  The room was on 3rd floor and small (but not uncomfortably so) clean and light and though it faced PCH (village view) it was quiet. In the summer it is good to have a north or east facing room to keep cooler. There was a safe, coffee maker, mini bar and refrigerator. They serve Starbucks' coffee in the lobby in the mornings starting at 6:00!   And the location is perfect, we parked the car when we arrived and didn't get back into it until time
Manager Response: Dear Bellauno,  And we too are glad that you stayed with us! We are in a perfect spot to enjoy Pageant of the Masters and everything else Laguna Beach has to offer, and we are happy that staying with us was a good compliment to the rest of your time in our town. I'm very happy too that we were able to get you into your room quickly and easily with a warm welcome. We hope you come back and visit us again soon. We look forward to it.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: We had never been to Laguna Beach. It's a beautiful destination with nice beaches, shopping, art galleries, and restaurants all within walking distance. We got a village view room. It was small, clean, and had comfy beds. The free coffee in the morning and wine in the evening is nice. It does help make up for the dull furnishings. Your mind set for The Inn should be the same mind set when visiting Europe. Small, sometimes bland furnishings ,and expensive. You are paying for the location here.
Manager Response: Dear Rebecca,  Thank you for taking the time to share this feedback with us. We strive to deliver exceptional experiences at our hotel, from cleanliness, friendliness, amenities and on, we hope to deliver a five-star stay. In this case it looks like we missed the mark and I am sorry for that. I hope you can visit us again and give us a chance to provide you the five-star experience I know we usually deliver. Thank you for taking the time to fill us in and for being our guest. We truly appreciate it.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: Hidden meeting home, on the sand!
Summary: Although we have stayed here well over 20 years, it was only recently we found out this hotel has a great board room for small meetings. The only "problem" with the meeting room is that is resides on the top floor with a 270 degree view of the Laguna Beach coastline! It is sometimes hard to get work done with such a beautiful distraction, but well worth it if you have a small group that needs a great meeting room. The adjacent deck is great for lunch and snacks, but "unfortunately" also acts as a guest wine reception area in the evenings, another distraction.
Manager Response: Dear zapprint,  Thank you for this amazing review and the gorgeous pictures. We can't thank you enough for staying with us over the past two decades! Wow!! And we are so happy you found one our two beautiful meeting rooms as a welcome surprise. We so appreciate you and these kind words and hope for many more decades of visits. We cherish it.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice little beach hotel with an awesome location.
Summary: The best thing about The Inn At Laguna is that it sits on a slight cliff next to the Main Beach which overlooks the ocean and is also within walking distance to all of the restaurants and shops downtown.  I would think that the next best thing, would be enjoying a lovely glass of wine on their intimate rooftop terrace facing the ocean (especially during their complimentary wine hour reception for the hotel guests every evening), but I regretfully couldn't experience that due to family obligations; I did really enjoy the view and the vibe on the terrace during the times where I was able to check it out for a hot minute before heading out.  We stayed for 4 days in a Village room on the 4th/top floor and decided against upgrading to an oceanfront room, since it was a really busy
Manager Response: Dear Beemyweenie,  While we would hope to have delivered a five-star experience, I thank you for this detailed review that truly gives me an opportunity to see the good, the bad and the indifferent from your experience. I'm happy you enjoyed our amazing location and lovely town, and the ambiance on our Terrace. But I am sorry that our service was not up to par with the expectations of a resort. We do hold ourselves to the highest standards, so I am sorry the team didn't give you the five-star treatment we should provide every guest. Please know that your words are taken to heart and will be used as an opportunity to improve. Thank you for staying with us.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: If you like boutique hotels, want to be on the water and close to all the amenities, the Inn at Laguna is amazing! Got away for our anniversary for 2-1/2 days, I had relayed reason for stay, and there was a complimentary bottle of chilled champagne in our room waiting for us. We had an ocean view room on 4th floor and the view was amazing (picture attached). Room was well decorated, king bed very comfortable, linens great! Included robes, in room safe, mini fridge, coffee maker w/coffee/tea, free internet, daily & newspaper. Walking distance to great restaurants and shopping and of course, down the short stairs to the beach (they provide towels, chairs & umbrellas. Service was impeccable, coffee, tea served in the am, cookies & milk in the afternoon, wine meet & greet in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a beautiful hotel. It was a bit more then what we wanted to pay but we did get an ocean view and the view was serene. Had breakfast on the balcony with the sound of the ocean. We ordered in room breakfast. Was a little disappointed with the menu selection and the coffee was not hot and bagel a bit tuff. Other then that I would definitely stay here again
Manager Response: Dear Pucca4,  Thank you so much for this generous five-star review! We so appreciate the feedback and are happy that your overall experience was great. The next time you visit, I hope those details on breakfast do not pop up again... sorry for that. Thanks for being our guest and we look forward to another visit.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Small, but stylish hotel, perfect location, with gorgeous views of Pacific!  Walking path with views of ocean is right outside the door..cute pool, nice lobby..rooftop bar for their complementary "social hour" is just fabulous..views of ocean and hilltops, great seating, endless amounts of wine..very cool. Prices are not cheap, but whole area is expensive, we had Village facing room, very small as was bathroom, but bed was comfy..all and all, such a cute area, lovely to stay and pet friendly!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Best location possible on the side of Laguna beach. Wonderful views from the rooms out over the ocean or the beach. In the middle of everything, it doesn't have a restaurant but you can order breakfast for your room, however all the delights of the town are walking distance. Good parking. Best bit is a roof bar from 2pm till late. Watch the sun go down and the colours change whilst sipping a glass of Californian wine.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Outstanding employees, and clean, simple rooms
Summary: The employees were outstanding, especially Sabiha, Monica, and Karen. These people made our stay incredibly nicer with their friendliness and knowledge. The rooms were clean, simple, small, and comfortable (we had 2 queens). The pool was great because it was rectangular, so you can swim laps in it. The hotel was in the center of a beautiful town, across from a nice breakfast place (The Orange Inn), and most importantly, a quick walk from the rocky, brought, and stunning ocean.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a fantastic stay at the Inn a few weeks ago. It's worth the splurge for an oceanfront room if you plan to spend much time in the room. We sat on our balcony, drank wine and people watched most of the day. Nicely decorated.   Don't miss the rooftop restaurant and bar. They will bring food (limited menu) over from Las Brisas for you. The service is very personal. They took great care of us.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Terrible experience - would never stay there again!
Summary: I brought my husband here for a surprise weekend. I used Hotwire and although it was a discounted rate, it wasn't inexpensive. Our room overlooked the parking lot (called the Garden View) - although there isn't a garden anywhere near to this room- Our room was so small you could't open the shutters- they hit the bed and it was so noisy at night. You could hear every car going down PCH so I tried to get a room on the other side of the hotel.   I asked if I might be moved to  a quieter room and three times was told by the front desk that because I used a 3rd party vendor, unfortunately, there was nothing they could do-- Although I was given the opportunity to upgrade for another $200 to a pool room.The pool areas was't the quietest either. Plenty of kids and although the pool is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel's close to the sand very nice
Summary: Really nice people to work with  in all areas.  Amenities  we're very good,  you had to pay for Wi-Fi and a set of amenities fees. The rooms were clean, good quality bed.  The rooms facing Pacific Coast Highway are noisy but otherwise in excellent experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Definitely the BEST in Laguna Beach!
Summary: The staff and location are impossible to beat. With the walking path and beach at our fingertips, and surrounded by amenities both in and outside of the hotel, we had everything we needed and more.  I am indebted to Gary for helping me book a poolside room, which I strongly recommend.  Beginning with the complimentary wine hour overlooking the Pacific (don't miss it!) and sprinkled with incredibly nice gestures from each and every staff member, we were in heaven. The only downside is the fact that we couldn't stay forever!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved our stay at the Inn. The Inn is a series of rooms and suites centered around little piazzas . They have a delicious breakfast in the cozy dining/living room.      There are rooms with ocean views.  Rooms are not large like a chain hotel.Although it is on the PCH we didn't mind. The beach is a hike but it was too cold to swim or sunbath. This may be a problem for people who want oceanfront.       Another great feature was covered parking which was included. It was a tight squeeze!      This place was great for us, and can be very romantic and charming. I loved the "look" of it.    Staff was pleasant and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am pleased to share a review of our visit to Inn at Laguna Beach last week.   The moment I arrived my son and his friends took off out the door and I hardly saw them all week. They had so much fun playing basketball, skateboarding, playing in the ocean, cruising around the village and all of the coves.  There was so much for them to do and explore. They are 12 to 14 years old.  I found a peaceful respite doing my own explorations, reading poolside, enjoying the cool air conditioning in the ocean breeze in my bedroom.   The staff was extraordinary. They provide a pool top happy hour we're guess from all over blend and socialize. They were super kind to a couple of my friends and family members that came through out the week to visit and socialize for a few hours. It was
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are frequent visitors to Laguna Beach. This was our first time staying at the Inn at Laguna Beach and it won't be our last! The location is perfect, on a bluff with a great view of the Pacific Ocean! The staff is fantastic, we were warmly welcomed the minute we walked into the lobby. The rooms are quiet and the beds are so comfortable! We love this place!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had to move rooms in the middle of our stay due to renovation/painting. Unfortunately, we were moved from an ocean view room to looking at the highway. It was an inconvenience but the location of this hotel cannot be beat. Right on the ocean and close to Laguna Beach's little downtown district. The kids enjoyed the pool but mostly, it is the location and the cleanliness of the rooms that will have us coming back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked a room here and was entirely disappointed with the quality of the room that was soo incredibly dark and noisy.  It was next to the pool and the pool pipes were right next to the window.  In addition there was no privacy and we had to close all the blinds at what was supposed to be a relaxing beach weekend.  When bringing this issue to the staff's attention I was dismissed and not offered anything based on the caliber of this room at a "luxury" hotel.  DO NOT visit this hotel... it completely ruined my weekend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a gem. Amazing views, nice rooms, helpful staff. It is one of my favorites and I highly recommend it great location, too. The bedding is really top notch. I don't have anything negative to say about it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here with my wife a while back and this was a fantastic location right on the beach.  This place was very nice, clean and friendly staff. I enjoyed staying here and I got an ocean view when I stayed here.  This is a great location with very nice view if you get the ocean front of course you would have to ask for the 2nd floor.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked through Hotel Tonight, so got a great price but beware that you're going to be sleeping next to PCH in the "village view" rooms and it's LOUD.  Comfortable King bed, nice clean room and upgraded toiletries which I enjoy.   Perfect location for early morning walks on the beach, lots of tide pools at low tide. Urth Cafe nearby had really awesome breakfast options.  We also really enjoyed the wine hour before heading to Nick's for dinner.  (*A Must try!)  One of the elevators was also down during our stay which made luggage a little tricky.   Another perk was the (saltwater?) hot tub in the pool area,  it was very nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: An amazing location to host a conference
Summary: As the person behind the scenes that helped to organize this business event, I couldn't have been more satisfied with the cooperation and follow through from the Staff at the hotel.  They were extremely accommodating and pleasant to work with.  There is no greater satisfaction as when your boss tells you everything was "Fabulous."  The hospitality, setting, accommodations and food all lent to a successful event.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed here a few times on business (our HQ is in Irvine, but my employer graciously puts us up at the beach ;-)  and in fact have another work trip planned for this month there.  Staff is always friendly and check in is efficient. They always try to help with any requests (forgot toothpaste once and they gave me a small tube; they can also make restaurant recommendations if you ask).  The hotel itself has a cozy feel.  It's been upgraded over the years. Some rooms are  somewhat small, while others are a bit larger and have couches in a small sitting area -- it depends on the room you book and are assigned, so ask!  All are very nicely appointed.  The rooms with an ocean view are great (for an obvious reason -- you can see the ocean! Some of balconies you can sit out on and
Manager Response: Dear bredonla,  Thank you so much for the great review! Happy your company puts you up with us and we look forward to your return later this month--we intend to bump that four star experience up to a fiver this time.   Truly a helpful review with great insights and I am really happy you could enjoy the wine hour with your coworkers on our awesome terrace along with the other conveniences and amenities our hotel has to offer!  Thank you for being our guest an taking the time to share your kind words with everyone here.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: While searching for places to have our wedding, my fiancé and I came across the Inn at Laguna Beach and absolutely fell in love with it. We had the pleasure of meeting with Gary (who was so unbelievably nice) and later had the pleasure of working with Adrienne (super sweet) when we decided to have our wedding there. Everyone we worked with was extremely nice and accommodating. The Inn is ideally located in the heart of Laguna and walking distance from shops, bars, main beach and much more. Property has a beautiful terrace which overlooks the ocean (also where they host daily cocktails). Rooms were lovely - several of our guests as well as my husband and I stayed in the ocean view rooms and we all loved the view and cleanliness. No complaints - would highly recommend the Inn at
Manager Response: Dear barbblade,  We are so honored that you chose us for such an important event and we all want to share our heartfelt congratulations with you! Gary and Adrienne pass along their thanks for your kind words about them... they and everyone else on our team are appreciative to have had such a lovely group as yours staying with us.  We look forward to many future visits from you, and we will make sure they honor the momentous occasion you shared with us. Please be sure to reach out to Gary, Adrienne or me directly for your return visits so we can be sure to take great care of you.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: good two night stay on the shores of the Pacific Ocean
Summary: Very helpful staff; great location, intriguing design, large beds, sensitive air conditioning, good tap water, some extra fees could be less, very good parking, fairly quiet though next to PCH, good roof top view of Laguna,
Manager Response: Dear John,  Thank you very much for the feedback and most of all for being our guest! We really appreciate it Happy yo hear you had a good stay and we hope you can come and visit us again soon.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: A wonderfully appointed property right on the beach.  The lobby is cozy with a lovely coffee service in the morning.  Knowledgable and friendly staff, received a breakfast recommendation which we took.  Ate at that place 2 days in a row.  Comfortable bed with duvet and high thread count sheets.  Received a welcome amenity that had a nice presentation and was quite delicious.  The staff is welcoming, the room spacious, and the views magical.  Cannot wait to return!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I do NOT regret splurging on myself by staying at this property while traveling on business.  Simply awesome.  Hotel is a gem tucked into cliff, and a cozy room literally steps from the main Laguna Beach landing.  Adjacent Las Brisas restaurant was just the icing on the cake.  All rooms face the ocean, which means that the halls face S. Coast Highway.  A little distracting as far as street noise, but quickly muffled by opening the screened balcony doors to hear the waves washing up on the beach.  Parking is available but limited, so get back to the hotel early.    This is one of the few times you just have to say to yourself 'Go For It!' and not ask any questions.  You'll be happy you did.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall it was a pretty good experience.
