Pros: Very centrally located, Underground garage for parking Cons: Overpriced for what you get, the day Front desk staff was not welcoming...staff in the evening were a lot nicer, We booked a ocean view and received a 1/2 window that you could see the ocean from the bathroom, the pictures make the pool look much bigger than it is in reality.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was exceptional, the beds were so comfortable, and the location was unbeatable. Love, love, love this hotel! I recommend this location to all my friends and family. Plus it's in the heart of the town!
Manager Response: none

Summary: What an amazing experience.  I can honestly say I had the best time I have had on a vacation ever.  The staff were amazing.  The view from our balcony was simply phenomenal.  I felt like I was on the coast of Italy looking out at the Mediterranean.  I will definitely be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: From the moment we checked in we loved this place. Staff went above and beyond to make our trip perfect. Cannot wait to book our stay for our anniversary in October. Room was clean and greatly located
Manager Response: Dear Debbie,  And we cannot wait to have you back! Thank you for sharing this wonderful review. You made our day. See you soon.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: I've wanted to stay at this hotel for years and now looking forward to a longer visit.  I booked a double queen pool view room and we were lucky to be upgraded to a corner suite ocean view room, Nirvana!   Even before the upgrade the staff was very efficient, pleasant and went out of there way to be helpful. Check in was a breeze.  Ekaterina was very helpful and Krystal made our trip very special. Thank you both.  What really makes the hotel is the location.  You are on the beach and all the shops & restaurants are within walking distance.  The views are spectacular!  Our room was understated beach elegance. The beds so comfortable, you could spend the day laying about & gazing out of the picture windows to just watch people on the beach.  There is a Juliette balcony off the
Manager Response: Dear fab61,  This is the kind of experience we strive for and we can't thank you enough for sharing it with us and everyone else! Ekaterina and Krystal are happy to hear they added to your stay, and we all hope you will come back and visit again soon. Thank you so much!  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: This hotel is very romantic, comfortable, clean, modern, the view was amazing and the location was PERFECT!  When we stay in Laguna, this is the only hotel we will probably ever go to!  I highly recommend it!
Manager Response: Dear 895trishaw,  We are honored to be your go to hotel in Laguna Beach. Thank you so much for the five-star review and the great recommendation. We look forward to many more future visits.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: It just doesn't get any better!
Summary: This beautiful, quaint hotel right on the beach offered up EXACTLY what we needed for a quick, last minute getaway from our busy life in Las Vegas. Rich and the staff were Amazing and very friendly. Rich even introduced us to another Vegas couple (Nice personal touch-We were not just a name). The rooftop terrace that overlooks the Ocean, with bar, mood lighting and a breathtaking view was perfect for relaxing after a day on the beach. They have a wine hour in the evening, when they offer free wine! Stephanie, the Bartender was super nice and very attentive. Everything you could possibly need is within walking distance, but you hate to leave the property with almost everything at your finger tips. We had an ocean view room, which based on its fresh clean scent, you would never
Manager Response: Dear carolinechavez52,  We are so happy we were able to deliver exactly the experience you were looking for. Rich is a wonderful asset to the team and I'm proud that he was able to add that extra touch to make your experience all the more enjoyable. He is thankful for the honorable mention!! The entire staff here thanks you for the kind words, and we can't wait to have you back.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: The hotel overlooks the beach and is in a fantastic location for exploring Laguna Beach. If you can afford it go for a sea view room as the views are worth it!! The hotel offers a free wine hour which was great for meeting other guests and taking in the view of the sunset on the terrace. staff were helpful and friendly. One to visit again
Manager Response: Dear Nicole,  Thanks you so much for this lovely five-star review. We love it! We hope you do come and visit again. We look forward to it.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: I say this place has been excellent they gave great service ,  made me feel so welcom , they are super friendly.  The hotel is so beautiful.  The wine hour on terrace is such a lovely and fun idea with a spectacular view !! Im returning here one day!  Thank you to staff at the inn .  The location was great and coffe and cookies .  I was very comfortable and got mucj needef rest .  Close to all the great beaches and village.  No car required!
Manager Response: Dear Mastroprimiano,  We are thrilled we could make you feel welcome and provide a five-star experience. Thank you for the kind words, and we look forward to that future visit you promised. Hope it isn't too far off.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Located on a small cliff that overlooks Laguna Beach, the Pacific Ocean, Catalina Island, and the charming coastal town of Laguna Beach is probably one of the nicest hotels I've found in all my journeys.  I save up to reserve an ocean view room (full balcony or Juliet balcony -both are lovely) and treat myself to some much needed re-energizing.  For the price -it's well worth it.  You will NOT pay for simply a view, which is often the case with other comparable hotels that let the interiors deteriorate and bank solely on their location.  The entire staff is welcoming and professional in their respective jobs.  The town's shops, restaurants, and beach activities are all within a 2 minute walk.  The rooms are light and airy, clean, and come with high scale step in showers,
Manager Response: Dear laddiesfriend,  We couldn't ask for a better endorsement than the title of your review. Wow!! Thank you so much. We are honored that we managed to make such an awesome impression. And it was such wonderful experience to read about, we can't thank you enough for sharing it with everyone. We thank you for coming here over the last 10 years and we look forward to many more going forward.   Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Over the years -yes, all 62 of them, I have stayed in many of the Laguna Beach hotels.  The Inn at Laguna Beach is by far the best value for your money.  I would recommend spending the extra dollars for an ocean view room, as the poolside rooms are lovely, but you are level with the pool area and privacy could be an issue, and the coast highway rooms don't have a view.  The ocean view rooms are spectacular!  Everything is well maintained and clean -they're right out of a magazine!  I've stayed at other hotels that offer views of the ocean, but they often are weathered and worn out.  The staff here is wonderful.  The last visit was my mother's 90th birthday and we were met with a bottle of wine, hugs from the housekeeping, and many well-wishers.  When I have traveled alone into
Manager Response: none

Summary: all the necessities... Easy place to rest your head when you really want to be on the beach. Next to the most amazingingly beautiful beach I've ever known and will always be my favorite beach destination
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Boutique hotel right on the water
Summary: You can't beat this location in Laguna Beach - this hotel is right on the water with the most gorgeous views of the beach, the water, and the hills of Laguna.  The rooms are very well kept.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very comfortable room.  Took a room facing the ocean with a french balcony.  A full balcony really wasn't necessary.  Hotel doesn't have a restaurant which is a down side.  The staff was accommodating and friendly.  Never saw housekeeping but the room was always taken care of.  Pool and hottub were nice.  Plenty of towels to go around.  It was early in the season so the pool was generally empty.  I can imagine it can get quite loud out there.  The walls were not thin as I could never hear a single neighbor though I could hear people on the walkway in the evening.  GREAT view.  Parking is expensive but the hotel is nicely located right on the PCH.  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A great Inn on the beach
Summary: We had a function at this locationand loved every minute of it. Great views, on the beach, within walking distance of shops and other Laguna Beach attractions, parking on site, and the entire staff was nice, respectful, and helpful in every way.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We picked this place because of location to area restaurants, shopping, etc. and the view! It met our expectations, but be prepared to walk up lots of stairs to get back from the beach. It is on a cliff, but the view is awesome.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location, location, location!!  Rooms are great. Everyone is happy to help. Parking is good. On the beach. Easy walk everywhere you want to go in town. Free wifi. Good meeting rooms. Meetings here are done well. Surf is audible all night. Comfortable. We will be back.
Manager Response: David,  Great feedback! We loved reading your review and are so happy you had a five-star experience staying with us. You really can't beat the location, especially listening to the sounds of the surf at the shore during the night. We truly look forward to your return visit, and many more after that.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Clean and comfortable room, amazing view and amazing service! We only stayed one night and wished we could have stayed for several. You cannot beat the location and in spite of it being in the middle of everything, it was very quiet. Loved our stay!
Manager Response: Dear Kelly,  And we loved reading about your experience! Thank you so very much for the kind words. We too wish your stay could have been longer and hope you will be able to come back and stay with us again in the future.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Great spot, perfect location to visit laguna. You are in the best spot, for sport in the morning, going around the see view... Beautifull place with a nice pool and jacuzi. Rooms are large, clean, modern, just a need a bath at this price. Good parking spot. Just a bit expensive but it is Laguna.
Manager Response: Dear Matinogue,  Thank you so much for your feedback. We are so happy that you enjoyed the location, pool, rooms and so much more. Thank you very much for being our guest.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: If you enjoy being centrally located and having a view of main beach and the ocean at the same time, then this hotel is worth a stay.  They also offer a wine hour at the top of the hotel.  It has a nice view, but can get a bit windy at times.  Staff is friendly and the Starbucks all you can drink coffee is great!
Manager Response: Dear Fallbrookfoodie,  From the Wine Hour on our terrace, free coffee in the morning to great views and a great location, it really sounds like you enjoyed your stay. We can't thank you enough for these kinds words, and even more for being our guest. We hope to see you again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: Can't Beat the Location and Service!
Summary: We stayed here for 4 days in April and had a gorgeous beach view from our own private balcony. Each night we were lulled to sleep by the sounds of the waves. Its literally on the sand at Main beach in Laguna. Easy walking to all the shops and restaurants in the the village. The service by every staff member we encountered was impeccable! Highly recommend if you want to enjoy a boutique hotel with unbeatable views and proximity to all the fun in Laguna.
Manager Response: Dear Amy,  What an absolutely wonderful review this was to read! Truly a joy and the kind of experience we strive for here. Thank you for sharing these kind words, I have passed them along to all of the team here. We truly hope you can come and visit us again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: You can see fantastic view from your room( not from street side)  Everything was amazing but parking lot. You need to be careful. It can scratch the under body of your car. There are so many restaurants and bars.
Manager Response: Dear Justin,  Thank you for the feedback and most of all thank you for being our guest. Glad you enjoyed Laguna Beach's wonderful restaurants, as well as the views from your room and the overall stay.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: You could not be in a finer location, the perfect spot for the beach, restaurants and shops.  A great hotel in terms of cleanliness, decor, welcoming staff, morning coffee, a friendly pool environment and an evening sundowner wine service where you get chance to take in the amazing coastal vista and meet other guests.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We selected the Inn for its location and were pleased to learn that there was a lot more to enjoy besides the conveniences that a boutique-size hotel can provide.  The beach views were spectacular, as our room faced the ocean and no more than 100 feet from the shore line.  Our room was so close in proximity that in the evening, the breaking sounds of the ocean waves added to our enjoyment and comfort. We joined other guests in the evening on the Terrace for complimentary wine and conversation.  Also, enjoyed room service from the adjoining restaurant "Las Brisas" for its exceptional efficiency and convenience in the morning.  Again the location made it advantageous to walk only a few feet to Heisler Park with its unique beach scenery; and fine restaurants on the South Coast
Manager Response: none

Summary: Business and pleasure kept us at the Inn for two nights.  Staff VERY friendly. Parking is under the hotel, easy...this is an older place, likely would have been a five.  The thing that makes it excellent is the location and view.  Get a room with a balcony facing the ocean.  Great.   Rooms a bit small, but well done, comfortable. Quiet...except for waves breaking!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beautiful property and location. Nice staff. Our room did not have a balcony, so be sure to ask about this when checking in. Also, they charge a $15/day resort fee, and $30/day for parking. We were not aware of these costs when booking. Although the staff was lovely, one of the other guests "f" bombed us in the parking lot when we were checking in, not a great way to start a vacation. But the rooftop bar makes it all worth it!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location but unimpressed by service.
Summary: Chose it because of its great location on the beach.Five minute walk to downtown shops. Next door to the Las Brisas Mexican restaurant. Underground parking for $30 a night - which seems reasonable. Rooms were comfortable and furnished with wicker furniture but for $670 a night seemed on the pricey side. Hotel doesn't have a restaurant so we had to cross the road for breakfast. Had phoned ahead to say we were coming in from an 18 hour flight from Sydney and if anything became available before the 4.00pm check in could they let us know ? When we arrived the guy on the front desk said that wouldn't be possible as check in time was fixed. Might have felt better about the hotel if he been more welcoming.Next time we'll stay in The Montage and drive into town.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely return.     LOCATION and the view from the rooftop bar are spectacular.   Staff were all extremely friendly and helpful.   Coffee in the lobby good.   Dog-friendly!!!  This hotel not only overlooks main beach, but is connected to the walking trails that pass in front of Las Brisas and down to the beach (look up Heisler Park).   We didn't mind paying extra for parking, but the surprise $15 Resort Fee (after paying $300 a night) is nickel & dime stuff.  It's not a resort / there is no exercise room or extensive resort grounds.  Complimentary wine tasting would have been nice if it was complimentary / not $15 extra (recommend you drop the "resort fee" and give guests a coupon for a free glass of wine).   Also --- the internet speed was
Manager Response: Dear rollngstone,  Thank you very much for this helpful feedback and most of all for being our guest. I value your input and will definitely take it into consideration. I'm thrilled the location, view and our helpful team stood out to you, but there is also always room for improvement, so thank you for the advice. We hope you can come back and visit us again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel RIGHT on the beach!
Summary: My wife and I had a great couple of nights this week at The Inn.  We had a room with a perfect view of the beach and waves.  So close to the waves, you could hear them all night long.....our favorite!  I would never say this was like a stay at the Ritz or Montage but its location is WAY BETTER and the access to the beach is fantastic,  I would stay there again and again.
Manager Response: Dear Thad,  Thank you to you and your wife for coming out and staying with us and taking the time to share this lovely review. We too think our location is unbeatable in Laguna Beach and we look forward to your many return visits.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Loved the view from our room.  The mini bar was stocked with everything needed for our stay.  Cleanliness takes an A++.  Very kind staff.  Nice location.  Parking is perfect.  Never had an issue at the property.  Rooms are set apart perfectly.  ENJOYED our stay.
Manager Response: Dear 525gabrielao,  We ENJOYED your review! Thank yo so very much for the kind words and the perfect five star rating. We hope you can come and stay with us again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: The Inn at Laguna Beach is perfectly located at the beach.  Everything about the hotel and its operation was cool, calm and collected.  Good restaurants are within walking distance as are some beautiful views.
Manager Response: Dear John,  We truly appreciate these kind words and even more appreciate you being our guest. We hope you can come and stay with us again!  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Very Sad. No Pay-Per View. Very loud. Staff doesn't really care to make things right.....Stay away from Ernest the manager as he is useless. Hotel has so much potential but comes very short of a pleasant experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay at this hotel every time I have business in South Orange county. Amazing views and perfectly located very near the town. Staff is great, very attentive.  Parking is good too, and that's a plus since parking is so difficult in Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Dear MattS3321,  Thank you so much for being an important and loyal guest of ours during your business trips to Laguna Beach. Thank you as well for these kind words. We look forward to continuing to have you as a guest... and a wonderful one at that.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: We are loyal repeat visitors to "The Inn", where we go to vacation from the bustle of the east coast.  From its close proximity to the beach and downtown to its quiet serenity amid local flora, we cannot get enough of this magnificent beach property....will definitely be back soon.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We celebrated my parents' 50th anniversary at the Inn last weekend and it was perfect.  We reserved both suites and 4 more rooms and it couldn't have been better.  They said they couldn't guarantee room placements, but we ended up with exactly what we asked for.  We had a lot of little unusual requests and the staff was VERY helpful and accommodating.  Everywhere you went around the property, there was staff there and each time they were great.,..specifically Stephanie and Omar in the terrace bar and Matthew, who was everywhere, seemed to be doing everything and always had a smile on his face.  The location and view can't be beat.
Manager Response: Dear gobigredone,  Congratulations to your parents on their 5oth anniversary and thank you so much for the honor of celebrating it at our hotel. Stephanie, Omar and Matthew thank you for them mentions and the entire team here thanks you for being such wonderful guests. We hope you will come and visit us again for many more anniversaries!  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: The hotel is located right on the water, right in town, and right next to the main beach. We had a room with 2 queen beds that faced the street and not the ocean. I was still very happy with the room even though we didn't pay extra the have a view. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The bath products they use are nice. There is a pool on the ocean side of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear KK,  And we hope you do come and stay with us again! Thank you so much for the feedback and most of all for being our guest.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: While clean and comfortable, this place is over-priced, probably due to it's location on the Pacific and within walking distance to all the restaurants, shopping and galleries of Laguna. The building is showing it's age and the décor and furnishing need an upgrade. You will be charged $30 to self-park your car underground. There's no valet. The additional "resort fee" gets you access to the pool, beach towels and umbrellas. You can order a continental breakfast made on site, but everything else is a la carte from local cafes. The terrace that you see in the pictures is exactly like that, but there is no bar service there on 2-3 nights a week. Nonetheless, folks seem to like this place. We didn't. To each his own. Note: Friendly helpful staff that couldn't do enough for us.
Manager Response: Dear JaneandAl,  I'm happy to hear that our team was so accommodating, the terrace was as beautiful as our pictures and that you enjoyed our ideal location. I'm sorry though that didn't amke up for some of the details you felt were missing. But we do take your comments to heart and hope you can come back in the future and give us another chance.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: If I could live here, I would!
Summary: I have been wanting to visit this hotel for the past 3 years and I finally got my chance in December when my husband and I drove from Las Vegas to Laguna Beach for an afternoon, while I was in Vegas for a conference.  We rented a car and drove 5 hours, one way, just to be able to spend some time here for an afternoon.  The hotel and grounds are in a perfect beach setting and the employees were wonderful.  We walked the grounds, spent time on the boardwalk and the beach and ate at Las Brisas, which is right next door to the hotel.  It was a perfect 3 hours and we can't wait to come back for an overnight stay.
Manager Response: Dear JulieFabris,  We are thrilled you were finally able to make it out to see us after such a long wait, and that it turned out to be such a great visit! It's wonderful guests like you that truly make the Inn a beautiful place both to visit and to work.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: This was our first stop on our way to San Diego.  You can't beat the location.  Beautiful views of the beach and the ocean.  Fabulous landscaping.  Our room was on the small side but was clean and fine for 1 night.  The only negative we encountered was check in.  We did arrive several hours early and the room was not ready.  Check-in was 4:00 and we did have to wait until then.  There were a few others also waiting for their room.  Other than that I would recommend this hotel for the location alone.
Manager Response: Dear DeeDee1024,  Thank you so much for the feedback and for the recommendation! Sorry we couldn't get you in early, but while we do our best it does depend on what we have available and when our other guests check out. Happy you enjoyed the stay overall and hope you can come back!  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: This place was the greatest hotel I've ever stayed at.  The room was so absolutely beautiful that it was almost impossible to leave it to go outside to the amazing view.  When we got there (around 11 at night), Ernest and Dave were there with smiles and told me not to worry about anything because it was so late.  They were incredible.  My cousins and I walked into our room and just about died.  Sleeping on the beds was like sleeping on absolute clouds.  We looked out the left window and there was the beach, the ocean, and the cliffs with superb houses.  We walked out onto our balcony, which had a table, two chairs and two beach loungers and overlooked the ocean.  From there, we looked to the right, and we saw the pool.  The stairs outside our room lead to the beach and it was
Manager Response: Dear Dana,  This is the kind of review we live for and we couldn't thank you enough for sharing such kind words. Reading about your experience is like a dream for us and we truly appreciate it! I've shared it with all of the staff here, and we all look forward to your next visit. Thank you so very much!  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Arrived on a Friday morning, but could not get into the room until almost 4:00.  Sat by the pool ( small area) and wandered around the town.  We had an ocean view room and, while the views are spectacular, the high cost of the room is not!  The room was clean and the staff friendly-nothing special. .  There is no restaurant on site and no exercise room, although plenty of walking opportunities outside the hotel.  The beach is steps away and shopping is, too.  Plenty of restaurants nearby.  There is a complimentary wine hour every evening on their rooftop area. They offer coffee in the lobby in the mornings, but " were out " when we went down the first morning. The location is the best feature of this boutique hotel.  Just be prepared to " pay for it ".
Manager Response: Dear valady7,  Thank you so much for being our guest and for sharing your feedback. We appreciate it all and hope you can return and visit us again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Superb location in it's ocean views and walkability to town. Excellent staff treatment. Rooms quite comfortable. Extra complementary services are lovely: evening wine on ocean-view terrace, morning lobby coffee service, evening tea service brought to room with turndown. Gret attention to detail in properties appearance and ambiance. Great value!
Manager Response: Dear lizsS656PZ,  We are thrilled to read about your experience while staying with us. So happy you enjoyed the wine-hour on our terrace, coffee-service and turndown. We pay a lot of attention to the details and are happy that you noticed. Thank you so much.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: Expensive but worth it for the location and the view
Summary: We stayed for three nights in a pool room which means that our patio opened onto the pool deck. The shrubs were not fully grown in so we could also see the ocean from our room too! Our kids loved the easy access to the pool and beach.  The inn had basketballs available for the courts at the beach. We spent time at the tide pools and on the ocean.  The wine reception each night was fun and the view from the rooftop was even better.  The Inn offers coffee in the morning and cookies and milk in the evenings in the lobby.  The location is the best feature of this property. We walked everywhere in Laguna Beach and enjoyed hearing the waves crash into the beach as we slept each night.
Manager Response: Dear jocomitchells,  Thank you so much for sharing your experience while visiting us. It sounds like you made the most of your visit; using the pool, going to the beach, joining other guests on the terrace for wine hour and getting out to explore our beachfront town. Also your description of drifting off to sleep with the sound of waves on the beach was just wonderful! We hope your family will come and stay with us many more times, and we thank you so much for sharing this exceptional experience.  Warm regards,  Casey  General Manager

Summary: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night in Oct 2015 and wished we had stayed longer.  We chose the Inn based on trip advisor reviews and we are so happy that we got to stay here. Laguna Beach was a stop off point for our trip from San Diego to LA, but in hindsight I would have definitely made my stay 2 or 3 nights as we absolutely loved the area and of course this delightful Inn.  We loved our stay at the Inn, it has an absolutely wonderful location right on the beach and the short cliff walk around the hotel is so scenic and peaceful. The staff were all helpful and friendly and nothing too much trouble. Our room was a village view, but very comfortable, clean and well equipped with Fridge, coffee tea making facilities etc. The complimentary Wine hour (and also the
Manager Response: Dear Danzi,  We too wish you could have stayed longer! But we are so happy that even your short visit could be such an enjoyable one. It sounds like you really made the most of it, with the beautiful cliff-side walks outside our doors and views from the rooms, and even the lovely wine hour on our rooftop terrace. We hope we are fortunate enough to have you back. Thank you for the lovely review.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Aside from the beautiful ocean-front views, the Inn at Laguna has exceptional service and attention to detail. The staff is so friendly and attention to detail makes the difference between a good stay and a great stay. Thoroughly enjoyed how easy it was to relax in luxury and feel taken care of. Looking forward to staying here again soon!
Manager Response: Dear Emily,  Thank you! We are truly focused on the details, and we are thrilled that you noticed. We thank you for being a wonderful guest and for taking the time to share such a wonderful review. We look forward to many future visits.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: This was our 2nd time staying at this amazing property.  The service exceeds from just pulling your car up, to checking in, to restaurants in the area....you feel cared for and cared about.  We will keep coming back and back and back again!  Thanks to all the staff at The Inn At Laguna Beach!
Manager Response: Dear C-Crummer,  We were very happy to have you back and look forward to many future visits. It was a delight to have you as a guest and we can't thank you enough for this lovely review. Hope to see you soon.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: THIS is a cool hotel. From the surf culturally correct historical photos on the walls, to the perfect coastal views, this place is the real deal. Great staff and comfortable rooms is only part of it. The place is older but perfectly kept. One would hope it would stay older--- it's an elegant classic. We had a birthday and on arrival there was a pretty splendid bunch of treats for us in the room. We will be back for sure. I suggest an upper story room facing the ocean with a balcony--- worth a few extra bucks.  I think we were in 301 or 302? Rooftop terrace and hosted wine thing each night--- was great and there is NO better view of the coast ANYwhere in southern California....A morning walk around the easy footpath that connects to the park is a perfect way to get the day
Manager Response: ear surfer55,  Thank you for the five-star review! "Elegant classic"! What a compliment!! We're thrilled we were able to surprise you with some treats for your birthday. We all hope to see you again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful views, great deal through this website
Summary: We originally had to book a king room due to the lack of double queen availability. But upon arriving, we saw through the window next to our room a double queen that was available. As it turned out, the room was an accidental double booking from someone else and the hotel management allowed us to switch rooms at no cost. The room was PERFECT for my friend and I. We loved sitting outside on the terrace that night under the heat lamps listening to the ocean waves crashing in and enjoying the beautiful night's weather. The bar tender was a great host! He even pulled one of the unused heat lamps over above us so that we had 2 to keep us warm and toasty. The parking garage was set up wonderfully with an elevator for easy luggage transport to our floor. The views from the hotel are
Manager Response: Dear Amber,  Thank you so much for sharing the feedback and for being our guest. We are really happy you enjoyed your stay and hope you will come and visit us again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: I am more than impressed with the staff, cleanliness, location, and EVERYTHING about the Inn. We stayed here for our wedding night and were greeted with a friendly staff upon check in. When we got to our room, there was champagne and a handwritten note waiting for us! We couldn't believe how wonderful this place is and we will make it the hotel we stay at for our anniversary each year.  Thank you thank you thank you for everything!!!
Manager Response: Dear jcolbo_927706,  Your experience truly means the world to us and we can't thank you enough for sharing it here. First off, congratulations!! We are honored that you would stay with us during you wedding night, and are thrilled it was such a great experience. We truly look forward to your many anniversary trips here and will celebrate the visit every time. Please reach out to us directly for next year's visit. We can't wait to have such wonderful guests back.  Warm regards and congratulations,  Casey General Manager

Summary: I had to be in Laguna for work and was thrilled that I was placed in this wonderful hotel. A terrific location, close to museums and galleries, cafes, the village and the beach. My only disappointments: 1) that I only needed to be in town for one night and 2) I can't afford this on my budget, so I won't be coming back any time soon.
Manager Response: Dear 535nickig,  We are thrilled that you were able to stay with us during your work visit! We hope you will come back soon, so that you can have more than one night with us and in our lovely town.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Im not sure it was worth the $350 a night I paid but I think it is in a nice location to shopping and the staff was very friendly and accomodating so maybe so....  The room was nautical in theme and the beds slept like a dream.  They are pet friendly so we could bring our little Pomeranian  There is no restaurant on property but I understand they have an arrangement with Las Brisas just next door to it for room service. They did have complimentary wine in the evening on the rooftop terrace for an hour.  Would I stay here again? Yes I guess I would but not before checking if I could find another beachfront for less as I really feel they were $100 more than they should have been
Manager Response: Dear Douglas8098,  We believe we offer a wonderful experience and product for any budget, and have an assortment of room types to ensure that. Happy you were able to bring your pooch at no extra charge, enjoy the complimentary wine hour and that overall you would come and visit us again. We look forward to it.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: What an unbelievable property and experience
Summary: Let me start off by saying that I rely heavily upon TripAdvisor for reviews on everything from restaurants, activities to do at a destination, to most importantly where to stay at a particular destination. I also generally do not leave reviews unless I'm emotionally moved, in either a positive or negative manner, from my experience. I checked into The Inn at Laguna Beach yesterday, I write this review as I'm sitting on my TRUE oceanfront balcony, listening to waves roll in. This is surreal. I am here for my honeymoon, and I can't tell you how many hours I poured over destinations and reviews trying to decide where to go and more importantly what property am I going to choose to make this the most special experience ever. Honestly, I booked another property here at Laguna
Manager Response: Dear Michael,  What a lovely experience this was to read about! We too rely on TripAdvisor to know how we are doing and to get the word out about us, so we can't thank you enough for sharing this thoughtful, wonderful review. This is the kind of experience we thrive on and I have been sure to share it with the entire team. We hope to have you back again soon!  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: If you want real ocean front, go elsewhere
Summary: From the look of it, only about 1/4, maybe less, of the rooms have full ocean view and not sit on the highway. So the chances are not high to get in one of the rooms people are raving about.   Yes, we requested an king ocean front balcony room. We got a king partial ocean view room. I said partial, because half of the hotel sits in front the other half on the beach side, and you only see the ocean if you look left. And as someone else mentioned, half of ocean view rooms actually sits between the highway and the beach, with nothing between your door and the highway! No wall! (Well, okay, there is a sort of barrier, so you won't fall off, but it's like those garden wall with holes in it, not a sound barrier) Which is very odd. You will get the highway noise, and it's LOUD. And
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this inn for an overnight stay on our SoCal trip. It was super cozy and one of our favorite places. The room was cozy feeling, from the shutters on the windows to the robes! Unfortunately, we were unable to get there by 6pm for the cocktails, which they add as a charge on the bill. The location is perfect for walking around Laguna and the view is awesome! I would give this five stars but feel it is overpriced for what you get. We had a rental car and had that fee as well.
Manager Response: Dear LIsaaah_13,  We are so happy to have been one of your favorite stops on your mother, daughter visit to Laguna Beach. Thank you so much for the feedback and for staying with us. We truly appreciate it!  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: All that we dreamed... and MORE!
Summary: Learned about this property through Tripadvisor.  So glad I trusted the reviews.  GREAT place!  Right on the water with steps down to a well-maintained beach and public area with restrooms, tidal pools and clean sands.        This Inn is clean and shows the pride of ownership.  It is quaint and the staff are so professional and helpful.  We requested a room with a view and upon arrival requested the top floor.  They did one better and gave us possibly the best room on the corner with a big balcony.  There are different room types here. Some without balconies, some with step out balconies and others with larger balconies with chairs and tables.  Was great to sit out and watch the sunset and sunrise. Our bed was situated with a view of the ocean and the waves are audible here from
Manager Response: Dear Molly,  We too are happy you found out about us here and that you are now sharing your wonderful experience staying at the Inn with everyone else on TripAdvisor! This is a very helpful review, full of many great insights and recommendations. From Margaritas by the pool, to watching sunrises on the balcony, it sounds like you really made the most of a great stay. Your five-star review means the world to us and we thank you so much for this and for being our guest.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: We were looking for an ocean front, comfortable room where we could include our two small dogs in an overnight stay.  The Inn at Laguna Beach was the perfect place!  Our room was exceptionally clean, beautifully updated, with a super comfortable bed covered in a crisp white duvet with lots of pillows.  The best part of it all though, was the breath-taking view of the ocean and city from our own personal balcony, and being lulled to sleep by the cadence of the waves at bedtime.   It was my birthday and the Inn had two delicious cupcakes and a birthday card on a tray in the room for our arrival.  The staff at the front desk, along with each hotel employee encountered, could not have been more accommodating or friendly. You are able have food delivered to your room from the nearby
Manager Response: Dear Georgette,  We are thrilled that you--and the pooches--had a great stay with us. We love your description of falling asleep to the sound of crashing waves. And we are over the moon that you had such wonderful experiences with our staff here. It is a great team. Thank you for celebrating your birthday with us, and we hope to see you here for many more.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Just a fantastic hotel right on the ocean, with beautiful views of the Pacific.  Make sure to request an oceanfront view room if at all possible.  The property is beautiful, walking distance to many shops and restaurants, and close to the beach.    Definitely a cool splurge place if you want a nice romantic getaway.
Manager Response: Dear Audrey,  Thank you very much for sharing your experience as our guest. We are thrilled it was a wonderful romantic getaway for you, and that you enjoyed the views from the hotel and were able to get out and explore the town as well. We truly appreciate the kind words and hope you can come and stay with us again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: From the moment we stepped in, this place was magical. Eketrina made the stay a sheer pleasure. One could spend close to $1000/night for a stay anywhere else that was as fulfilling and as exhilarating with some breath-taking ocean views.  Great restaurants just a few minutes away. Do get breakfast at Shirley's Bagels. Lunch and Dinner at Skyloft, Rusty Pelican(Newport Beach) are good recommendations. Hotel serves a wine happy hour between 5-6pm everyday at their Pacific Ocean Terrace. Resort fees include beach towels, Chairs and umbrella and you walk through the stairs from the hotel directly into the beach. You get a private beach experience at the most affordable rates.
Manager Response: Dear Mohsin1978,  Thank you for the wonderful review and great recommendations on the local spots to visit and experiences not to miss out on at the hotel. I have shared your kind words with Ekaterina and she, along with everyone else here, is delighted to have provided you a five-star experience during your visit to Laguna Beach. We hope you will come and stay with us many more times.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing ocean view room and friendly staff
Summary: It was our first visit to Laguna Beach, and we were so glad that we stayed at The Inn in an ocean view room with a balcony.  The view from the balcony was amazing, whether it's morning sun or evening sunset. We enjoyed the ocean breeze and the sound of magnificent wave breaking in our room, which reminded us that we are in California.  The location of The Inn was perfect, next to the beach/park on the right side and the shops/restaurants on the left.  We enjoyed the evening wine reception, watching the sunset every day. Most of all, our six year old son was in the cast, needing to use crutches to move around.  When the front desk staff brought out a wheelchair to use during our stay, we were very grateful- it was a god-send!  We would absolutely stay at The Inn again next time
Manager Response: Dear Kim,  We were so happy to be able to give you and your son a little more comfort during your visit. An experience like yours is what we live for, and I have shared your words with the entire team. So happy too that you enjoyed the sounds of the crashing waves, views of the ocean and our overall great location. Thank you so much for staying with us and for sharing the kind review. We hope you come and visit us again many more times.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: I do not know enough superlatives to describe our incredible experience at this property.  I booked an ocean front room with balcony but when we arrived we were given the "sunset room".  When we opened the door, we literally stopped in our tracks.  We opened the sliding glass door to our private patio only to discover a 180 degree view,unobstructed to the right and left, up and down the beach in both directions.  We were so totally mesmerized by the view, that we had difficulty leaving.  In fact one night we bought a pizza at Whole foods and ate it while watching the sunset.  My only complaint was the a/c unit.  It was so loud we couldn't sleep with it on but couldn't sleep with the heat.  With the door open, the breezes helped but the ocean crashed so irregularly against the
Manager Response: Dear GoldenJudy,  A wonderful review from a wonderful guest! We are thrilled you enjoyed the awesome views from our rooms, the great location and that you were able to get out and enjoy the park with your dog. We can't thank you enough for this five-star review. Most of all, thank you so much for being our guest.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: As a meeting planner for a medical organization, we experienced the Inn over the weekend 28-31 and it was a wonderful experience both from the meeting perspective and as a guest.  The level of service from the staff is top notch - perhaps only to be surpassed by the incredible view.  Can't wait to go back!
Manager Response: Dear 06Tammie,  It was our absolute pleasure hosting you and your group during your visit. It was a delight to read about your experience and I have shared it with the entire team. Our hotel is a perfect venue for meetings, groups and gatherings of any kind and we are thrilled you found that to be true. We truly look forward to many future visits. Thank you so much for the kind words.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: The Inn at Laguna Beach was excellent. Super neat and clean rooms, exceptionally well appointed. Outstanding and very friendly staff. Perfect location for beach and town. Highly recommended. They do, however, charge $30 for parking and a resort fee of $15 per day which was not indicated in anything I saw beforehand.
Manager Response: Dear Romipe,   Thank you so much for the five-star review! It was wonderful to read about your experience and even better to have you as a guest. We hope to have you back for many more visits and truly look forward to it. Thank you so much.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: Stunning Sunsetsbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb - With a Price Tag
Summary: This is a beautiful, (well-maintained, historic) property with a fantastic view of the ocean and a good location within walking distance of the main shopping area and restaurants.  It has wonderful amenities (a delivery of gourmet cupcakes upon arrival, wine tasting in the evenings, coffee and newspaper in the morning), and comfortable rooms.  I would give it five stars if I wasn't so annoyed about being "nickeled and dimed" to death!!  In addition to the room rate and (not unexpected) high "room tax," we were charged $30/day for parking and another $15/day "amenities fee" (for the aforementioned wine tasting, etc.)  I would have rathered pay a bit more for the room and had the price be all-inclusive!
Manager Response: Dear travelingmimi99,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience while staying with us. I was thrilled to read that you enjoyed our one of a kind location right on the beach, with breathtaking views of the ocean, close proximity to downtown and a beautiful hotel with historic roots. However, I am sorry that our resort fee and the included amenities that come with it, such as internet, wine hour on the terrace, wifi and more didn't quite deliver on value for you. I do want you to know that I will personally take this into consideration, and greatly appreciate your feedback. I hope you'll return and give us a chance to deliver that five-star experience I know we are capable of.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Stayed in Room #424. The floor had a weird uneven drop off that I nearly tripped on several times. We have stayed at this hotel a few times. I have had some pretty good rooms and some, like 424, that weren't so hot. I did request a higher floor away from traffic. I was pleased it was on the fourth floor, but because the door to the room faces PCH, and there is no hallway, this room is unusually loud. I did request to switch rooms, but there were none available. We got about 3 hours of sleep, which was a huge bummer because we came to relax. I live near street noise, so I'm used to that and this is crazy loud. The view is 1/2 the ocean as there is a large wall to one side, so you cannot see the sunset. What is frustrating is that you can 'request' certain areas of the hotel, but
Manager Response: Dear bcinsd15,  While I was disappointed to read your review, I am happy we were able to get in touch with you and get your concerns sorted out. It is very important to us to understand how it feels to be our guest and in your case to learn some ways in which we might improve. And hopefully we have shown you just how important it is to delight every one of our guests. Again, we are happy we could talk and we look forward to your return visit.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: It is said that the ultimate recommendation is that one would return to an establishment. We do that with Inn at Laguna Beach. We're regulars. This latest visit was for our little family unit (2 humans and 2 dogs), to celebrate Christmas.  The Laguna Vista Suite (#507) is fabulous. It's roomy (two queen beds), 180 degree balcony, breathtaking ocean views. If you love the ocean, you will be in heaven!   The hotel is genuinely pet friendly (some places claim this, but we have found them more accurately described as pet tolerant). Reception staff engage with their furry guests. At least they did with ours. Complimentary coffee each am is a nice touch. Complimentary wine hour followed by cookies and milk is a small thing, but strangely I find it to be really welcoming. Kind of an
Manager Response: Dear Kate,  Yours is the kind of experience we live for and we couldn't ask for a higher compliment than to have such a lovely family (people and pooches) return to visit us again. We can't thank you enough for these kind words and for such a lovely recommendation. We look forward to many return visits and thank you very much for being our guests... and lovely ones at that.   Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: My rooms were small or the price, but it was clean, a comfortable bed, and the ocean was right outside. I've stayed here twice and been happy both times. It is an easy walk to the small downtown area.
Manager Response: Dear smilingcarolyn,  We couldn't ask for a higher compliment than having a return guest like you. We are truly happy you enjoy the cleanliness, location, and our comfy beds during your stays with us. We hope to have you here many more times and greatly look forward to it.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Staff was extremely polite and helpful.  Rooms were clean and large. We were on the 'ocean side' and the sounds of the waves were soothing. Within walking distance of best restaurants in Laguna-such as Carmelita's. Complimentary Starbucks in the lobby in the morning.
Manager Response: Dear RadIrish,  What a poetic review! We couldn't ask for a more lovely description of what it feels like to be our guest. Thank you very much for taking the time to share such wonderful words and most of all thank you for being our guest.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, avoid road noise room
Summary: This hotel was a cute smaller hotel right on the coast.  There are many positives.  I will get the one negative out of the way, if you get a room with a door on the road, the road noise is bad.  Often the wave noise cancelled it out, but if not, its pretty loud.  For the positives, the staff was very friendly, the rooms were very clean and the am coffee in the lobby was a nice plus.  The hotel is right near the main part of town.  We were able to park easily at the hotel and never took our car once we arrived, we were able to walk everywhere.  One other nice touch was the binoculars in the room.  We did see whales and dolphins and that was an added bonus.    I'd stay again, but not on the road.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Laguna!!
Summary: Everything about the Inn is perfect: LOCATION is number one. It is ON the ocean NEXT TO the beach ACROSS FROM a Starbucks and a SHORT WALK to Forest Ave shops and restaurants (try Alessa). Staff were all so nice - room was great-  complimentary wine on the ocean view patio - beautiful sunset - AWESOME!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing location and views, great staff, a little noisy.
Summary: Just stayed at the Inn for a friend's wedding on New Year's Eve.  You can't beat the location and views from this hotel.  Walk down the steps to the beach in minutes, downtown Laguna is only a short stroll away.  Great photo spots everywhere as the hotel is literally on a bluff overlooking the ocean.  My room was nice and the staff were very friendly/accommodating.  They even gave me a complimentary bottle of champagne for NYE.  The only negative during my stay was that the people in the room above me were very loud.  It's an older (yet nicely maintained) hotel and the floors are a little thin & creaky.  The easy fix is to request a room on the top floor, which I'll do if I stay here again.  Overall a great experience at this nice hotel in a beautiful location.  Bonus tip:  Go
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice location with good service, but the lack of good ocean views from my room, noise from adjacent rooms, and the just average quality of the rooms do not justify the high room prices.  However, this hotel is within easy walking distance from the beaches, parks, and restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Gassaway B,  We would like to thank you for taking the time to remark on your recent stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach and are pleased to hear you enjoyed both our location and service. Our close proximity to Main Beach and the village is definitely a top feature!  We are sorry to learn that your room did not offer the boutique luxury that we pride ourselves on.  While many of our rooms offer stunning ocean views, there are a few that do not.  Should future travels bring you back to Laguna Beach, we hope you will consider another stay with us in a true ocean-view room.  Thank you, Guest Services The Inn at Laguna Beach

Summary: We showed up a few hours early and they checked us in right away.  The staff was very nice and efficient.   Access to the beach is nice - the rooms are a bit small but efficiently laid out.   The only shortcoming is that the pool view rooms on the 3rd floor are right next to the pool - your room may be a little less private when the pool is busy.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My title says it all. We have been staying here for years, but the prices keep shooting through the roof! Our room #424, was mediocre at best. The floor was totally uneven, and we tripped several times on what seemed to be a plywood patch under the carpet. I would have expected better at over $400 a night in December. Bed was comfortable, but pillows were worn and hard. Bath and shower area were standard hotel/motel quality, with very little decor. If you are wanting to enjoy the sunset, make it clear to the staff that you get a room other than S/W facing, as we could not see it from our room.
Manager Response: Dear Steve O,  Thank you for taking the time to remark on your recent stay at The Inn.  We appreciate your comments and your return business.  We are sorry to learn that room #424 did not live up to our usual standard of excellence.  Our engineering team has been alerted to the floor concern and new pillows are in the works!    Noting that a sunset view is important to you, we encourage you to consider a top floor king room with a Juliet balcony, an oceanview king room (no balcony) or an oceanview queen/queen room with a balcony the next time your travels bring you to Laguna Beach.  We hope you will reach out to us in advance so that we may assist with these accommodations.  Thank you, Guest Relations The Inn at Laguna Beach

Summary: The hotel was welcoming,especially the reception. Room was nice and clean with a nice view,shame for the bad weather,but that can't be helped during this time of the year.  Bar staff was nice and friendly!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good location friendly staff that offer chairs towels and umbrellas for you to take to the beach with no charge have nightly cocktail hour for wine you can walk to almost anywhere in Laguna Beach. No we did not get a auction view room the room was comfortable the beds were great noise was minimal
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Unbeatable location in Laguna and a comfy bed gets this listing 4 stars with a travelzoo deal.
Summary: The Inn at Laguna Beach is in an undeniably ideal location. From room 302, an Ocean View King with Balcony, we had a stellar view of the ocean and were just a few flights up from the sand. The bed was super comfy. Housekeeping was incredibly sweet. Front desk was predictably nice, but not terribly helpful.  From a service standpoint, it was more like a very friendly motel than a luxury resort. From a property standpoint it was more like an upscale motel.  Beware that the front doors of some rooms (like 301, 302, 303 and 304) open to PCH. Its RIGHT THERE. We asked for extra towels to cover up the gap at the bottom of our front door and left our sliding glass door open all night to hear the waves in an effort to muffle the sound of PCH traffic. Other rooms might not have that
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Inn at Laguna Beach was FANTASTIC!
Summary: Quaint hotel overlooking beautiful Laguna Beach. Room was nicely appointed with floor-to-ceiling shutters that opened to sliding glass doors and private balcony, providing unobstructed views of the Pacific Ocean.  Location was excellent. Beach, shopping and dining were very short walk from hotel. Evening wine-down on hotel's 4th floor terrace was very nice way to meet other guests and enjoy picture perfect sunsets.  Look forward to returning soon with my family!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had paid for the village room.  The room was very small and musty.  In addition, they had a couch that was in front of a blank wall...very bizarre.  End up paying about $450for a water view.  Not what I had expected.  Overall very disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear David F.,  We would like to thank you for taking the time to remark on your recent stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach. We truly appreciate all feedback, both positive and negative, as it helps us to continuously improve our product and service. We are sorry to learn that your Village room did not meet the expectation of boutique luxury that we pride ourselves on.  We hope that your ocean-view room was much more enjoyable.  We hope your travels will bring you back to Laguna Beach in the future and particularly to The Inn at Laguna Beach for a warm welcome.  Thank you, Guest Services The Inn at Laguna Beach

Summary: I've stayed here three times: once for a family vacation, once for business and once for a getaway. All three times, the location worked perfectly, the service was professional and timely and the accommodations outstanding. The Inn is not a luxury hotel like the Montage. Instead it is in the heart of Laguna Beach, right on the beach and how can you go wrong with Las Brisas right next door, literally two sips of a margarita away. Walking distance to everything: shops, bistros and Starbucks!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Teh hotel was located close to the beach whit a breath taking view whit butyfull sunset. There were many nice restaurant and there was plenty of things do do around. The cookies were very good too ......
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Inn at Laguna Beach was at its very best during our two night stay! We had all of the eclectic shops, galleries, and restaurants just outside our front door and the beautiful Pacific  right outside our back door! Check-in was a breeze and the staff was very warm and friendly! With the Urth Caffè just a one minute walk away...you can't go wrong!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary here, and we hope this becomes our tradition. We loved being so close to the water. The staff was excellent, especially Will at the front desk. People were helpful and knew the area for dinner recommends at local picks. Inn at Laguan was just a perfect place to have some time away.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I can't think of one negative comment to make.   Smooth, accommodating check in- service above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied.   Nice Starbucks in the AM- cucumber water during the day- and a rooftop wine hour each evening topped off with cookies and milk.   Views are AMAZING.   Parking easy (though $30/ day) and access to town is an easy stroll.   Would go back again in a heart beat!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Inn is in a wonderful position and our three nights there lived up to all expectations.  You are right on the beach and the pool is an ideal spot to just crash.  Super restaurants are very close by. Las Brisas is literally next door and Nick's is only 5 minutes walk away. Both are well worth a visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Laguna Beach one side Downtown LB to the other...Remarkable Sunsets!
Summary: Parking and check-in was a breeze. Getting to the room no problem. Arriving in Room very clean , fresh clean white linen on comfy beds, decent sized kitchenette w/o any dysfunctions, Bathroom was Clean but slightly dated and to the eye not congruent with the room (But everything worked perfectly). Views from Sm/Med balcony compelling and romantic! Service 4.5--really above average. Breakfast in Bed for 2 was fresh, generous, tasty and hot. Delivered at exactly the time we requested( even though i wish they would have waited another 30min).   Beach was immed toSouthWest of property...2min walk. Closest part of DT Laguna Beach was 1/3 mile away.... But a car will be optimal for dining or sightseeing.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place on the ocean, beach and views eye stunning. Best sunset over ocean. Room very nice. Was able to hear the ocean all night from room with the window open, and the room did not face the ocean direct.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Upon arriving my friend and I were asking for help right out of the gate. We needed to check in early and/or hold our luggage for us. They accommodated us with an early check-in and needed only a half hour and held our luggage for us while we waited. The hotel is on the beach and just a few steps from the ocean. I purchased the itinerary from "Get a Room" and a "pool view". The room we were given was a pool view room however, without a view of the ocean and next to the pool cleaner/pump. I asked that we be moved to a room that was not next to the pool pump and boy were we accommodated. We stayed in room 306 at the top of the stairs from the lobby. The room had a balcony with views of the ocean and Laguna. The room was clean and the views spectacular with privacy from the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Has been better in the past....
Summary: Came back again as was so impressed with last stay.  However, rooms are feeling tired.  I assume most of the "flaws" in the room such as banged up doors and baseboards are from housekeeping being sloppy with vacuum cleaners and such.  Rooms need a refresh.  1st room we were put in (#424) felt like a portion of the old restaurant that was converted into a make shift room...musty, no air circulation, slider that was off its tracks and overall nasty.  would not sleep in it if free.  The on duty manager was as nice as he could be and did move us to a better room.  All in all, doubt would come back.
Manager Response: Dear Mark A,  Thank you for taking the time to remark on your recent stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach.  We are so sorry to learn that this visit did lot live up to your previous positive experiences with us.  Your feedback is greatly valued and will be shared with our team to help us continue to improve in all areas.  We would like to assure you that the areas of concern are not a normal occurrence and we are working diligently to repair them.  Should future travels bring you back to Laguna Beach, please reach out to us directly so that we may assist in arranging your reservation and ensure that your stay with us is memorable.  Thank you, Emily D. Guest Services

Summary: Want to fall asleep to the sounds of the ocean? This property's location adjacent to the main town beach and overlooking the ocean delivers everything you want in an oceanview hotel. Rooms are clean, bright and "beach contemporary" with large shuttered windows affording a priceless ocean view. Bathrooms only have showers, overall nothing special especially for the steep premium you will pay for the hotel's location and oceanview rooms. Hotel has lovely meandering paths overlooking the beach that connect to next door Las Brisas restaurant with equally beautiful ocean views. Location to shop and dine in town is unbeatable, and with parking at a premium in town the $30/nite parking isn't outrageous. Front desk very helpful, check-in was easy but I would imagine in prime summer
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing Wedding Weekend at the Inn
Summary: This past weekend we planned our Engagement Party at the Inn that ended up being our SURPRISE Wedding! To say it was perfect would not do it justice! We rented out the Pacific Terrace and along with that you rent out the rooms that surround the Terrace as to not disturb any of the other guests. Not a problem, the rooms sit right on the water and have balconies and breath taking views! The rooms are all remodeled gorgeous and modern and all very comfortable. Gary handled all the rooms and truly went above and beyond for our group. Since it was a busy weekend in Laguna he sent our overflow guest the The Laguna Beach House 2 blocks away. I checked out the rooms there and it so magically done. Although I didn't stay there, all my guests that did stay there loved it! Adrienne, the
Manager Response: Dear KidDKat,  Congratulations on your surprise wedding and thank you for choosing The Inn at Laguna Beach for this very special occasion!  We are thrilled to hear that our team provided excellent service and that your entire weekend was a success.  We look forward to having you and your guests return for future visits to Laguna Beach!  Thank you, Guest Services The Inn at Laguna Beach

Summary: Love this iconic beach hotel . From the first meant to the last, the service and staff were impeccable . The manger and maintenance team were quick to help us figure out handling the dealing with a dead battery on th morning of departure. They were awesome. But back to the hotel, we had a gorgeous ocean view on the 5 th floor with a balcony and sliding glass doors which when opened allowed the very strong ocean roar lull us to sleep. Very comfortable and great location for the art enthusiast that I am- tons of galleries of really nice fine art.
Manager Response: Dear gamegirl1958,  Thank you so much for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach.  We pride ourselves on personalized service and always appreciate hearing when our team rises to the needs of our guests.  We are thrilled that you enjoyed one of our premiere ocean-view rooms and the close proximity to the many art galleries in Laguna.  We hope your next visit will bring you back to The Inn.  Thank you, Guest Services The Inn at Laguna Beach

Summary: The Inn is in the heart of Laguna Beach so accessibility of restaurants, galleries, beach activities is ideal. Overall it was a delightful Inn w so many accommodating staff. Our room overlooked the entrance to the inn which was fine since we weren't on the first floor.
Manager Response: Dear Rae-48895,  Thank you for taking the time to remark on your recent stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach.  You mentioned two of our greatest assets: our proximity to restaurants, galleries and the beach and our dedicated guest services team.  We are so pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and hope you will stay with us again on your next visit to Laguna Beach.  Thank you, Guest Services The Inn at Laguna Beach

Summary: This was our second stay in a year.  This time we had a room with a balcony on the ocean.  When we got to our room there was a cheese and salami tray with crackers.  They have free wine tasting in the late afternoon then cookies and milk in the early evening.  And then they bring sleepy time tea with honey later.  This hotel is extremely nice. Top notch hotel in Laguna Beach
Manager Response: none

Summary: A big thank you to the Inn at Laguna Beach for making our 1st anniversary as special as they made our wedding last September 20th. Special thanks to Gary Bolotin for going the extra mile and reserving the wonderful suite that is so special to us. We will continue to return to this charming inn for many years to come. The location can not be beat, the staff is amazing and everything about The Inn is just wonderful. Thanks again! Brad & Jo
Manager Response: Dear Jo S,  Thank YOU for returning to The Inn at Laguna Beach to celebrate your first anniversary!  We are honored to be a part of your tradition and thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay.  See you next year!  Thank you, Guest Services The Inn at Laguna Beach

Summary: Very clean and good value. Good location. Air con is slightly on the noisy side. Despite being next to Highway 1 the rooms are soundproof and do the job. We would recommend the hotel for a stop over (which we did during our California trip)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Warm Welcome, Fantastic Rooms and Perfect Location
Summary: I cannot recommend a stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach highly enough. We stayed for one night during our honeymoon road trip through California, and were so enamoured that we wish we could have stayed for longer. The service was excellent- very friendly, efficient, and the little extras like cookies and milk in the early evening were brilliant. Our room was lovely- very comfortable, clean, nice decoration and very comfortable beds. We even had a night time tea waiting for us in the room after dinner- a great touch! Will certainly be visiting again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Laguna Beach is an amazing town, both quaint and lively.  The inn is a relaxed hotel in the center of everything.  Beginning the day with coffee on the balcony, lead to a day at the main beach and hotel pool and ended with the hotel's complementary reception overlooking the ocean. This hotel has nice hotel rooms but it is the service, location and amenities which make it a great choice.  Bring your family or ask for a quiet room If you are a couple.  .  The Inn is a good choice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We changed rooms in order to get an ocean view. The view was obstructed & the balcony was tiny. The Ac was extremely noisy. We usually stay at the Surf & Sand and will be returning there next visit. We were extremely disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Dawn C,  We would like to thank you for taking the time to remark on your recent stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach.  We truly appreciate all feedback, both positive and negative, as it helps us to continuously improve our product and service.  We regret that you did not experience the boutique luxury and personalized service we pride ourselves on.  We would love to invite you back for a return stay, where we might have the opportunity to WOW you with an experience more in line with our standards.  Please reach out to us the next time you plan to visit Laguna Beach.  Thank you, Guest Services The Inn at Laguna Beach

Summary: Boutique hotel on the beach in Laguna. Wonderful views, service, amenities. Food, cookies, beach supplies, everything ready and available. Front desk staff excellent, able to walk anywhere, decor newly upgraded.
Manager Response: Dear Jeanette S,  Thank you for taking the time to remark about your recent stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach.  You touched on several of our greatest assets - location, service and amenities.  We are proud to work with a great group of individuals who care about each guest encounter and love to hear when our team exceeds expectations.    We hope to see you back for a return visit soon!  Emily

Summary: We got this at good price so that colours my review. We were in the cheapest room overlooking the car park but we knew we were getting that. Parking is $30 per day which in LB is ok. We would return but really because we love LB not the hotel. The air conditioning sounded like a jet taking off and the fridge rattled too. If we hadn't had jet lag I'm not sure we would have slept well. But, this sound negative. It's a host walk to the town with the great beach and great bars and eating places. The evening drinks reception was good. Nice to get a coffee in the morning. If you come to LB it's fine but go for a good room.
Manager Response: Dear Scapa,  Thank you for your comments regarding your recent visit to The Inn at Laguna Beach.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed both our location and amenities, including coffee in the morning and complimentary wine at night.  We apologize for the noise you experienced and will certainly share this feedback with our maintenance team to have those issues addressed.  Should your travels bring you back to Laguna Beach, we hope you will visit The Inn again and allow us to offer a warm welcome.  Thank you again for your feedback, which we appreciate and use to improve our product and service.  Emily

Summary Heading: Good because of location, service and view, everything else less than average for what you pay.
Summary: First, I would say this hotel is in between average and good.  The great points:  The view is spectacular (if you get an ocean view room) and from the terrace where they have a daily 5-6pm wine reception.  The location is the best in Laguna Beach.  Best beach, nice walking distance to restaurant and shops.  Service was also great by the staff.  Very attentive.  The Good:  Pool was nice and adequate for the hotel, but nothing to rave about.  Wine reception was nice but very limited in time in my opinion.  The Average: For the price we paid ($500+ a night) I felt like the hotel was not at par.  Yes, it had a great view and location, and the hotel was clean but there was nothing spectacular about the rooms or the hotel.  There is no attention to detail, nothing that would make you
Manager Response: Dear reyrios,  Thank you for your comments regarding your recent visit to The Inn at Laguna Beach.  You touched on two of our greatest assets: our team and our location.  We have a great group of individuals who care about each guest encounter and our location is second to none.   We do apologize that you did not experience the extra attention to detail that we agree to be a key factor in overall guest satisfaction.  We take all comments seriously, as they help to improve our products and service, and yours will definitely be shared with the team.    We hope your travels will bring you back to Laguna Beach in the future and particularly to The Inn at Laguna Beach for a warm welcome.  Emily

Summary Heading: August 2015 long weekend at the Inn.
Summary: We stayed on the 5th floor in king room with small balcony.  The room was very clean and the sevice was excellent.  The location of the hotel is great.  The only negative is the parking which is very limited but we were always able to squeeze in when we needed to.  It is also very expensive around $600.00/night
Manager Response: Dear Don T.,  Thank you for your comments regarding your recent long weekend at The Inn at Laguna Beach.  You touched on two of our greatest assets - our service and our location.  Our team is comprised of a great group of individuals who care about each guest encounter and our location is second to none.  Busy Summer weekends certainly have our parking lot a bit more full, but we are pleased to hear you found a spot when you needed to.  We certainly hope you will return to Laguna Beach for another long weekend in the future and would love to have you stay at The Inn once again.  Emily

Summary: My husband stayed at this hotel for a short two night getaway. It is beautiful. And right on the beach. They really treat their guest great. The have a wine hour up on the deck over looking the ocean. Fresh baked cookies and cold milk at night and coffee in the morning. We can't wait to go back and stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here twice and will always come back.  Great rooms.  (only bad things it the rooms on the top floor if you are over on the "far right" - facing the ocean -above the pool, you can be looked directly into by people on the walkway).   Great location.  Friendly staff. Easy to walk everywhere or Uber to where you want to go.  Only nit pick is that they don't have enough chairs and umbrellas for all the guests. They allow you to keep them in your room but that means you may not get them!    Much better than the other hotels we have stayed at in Laguna.  Oh yeah, my wife would say the hotel provided hair dryer sucks!  She has long hair and we burned it out.  Bought a travel one from the local hardware store the next day!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved this hotel.  It was the last hotel on a week long road trip.  It was thoughtful in its decor, great location on the beach, nice wine hour, delicious cookies, clean and well maintained.  The staff was on top of their service and very helpful.  We did not have a room facing the ocean but were facing the beautiful hills.  We could walk out on the balcony and around the corner and see the ocean.  We also did not have to pay ocean view prices and still got a great benefit of being an ocean front hotel.  I loved this hotel and want to return for a staycation soon!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great views of the beach and Heisler Park.  Location couldn't be much better - short walk to downtown area, easy access to beach.  Pool is small, but clean and wasn't busy when we were there.  Great for couples.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We visited this hotel in July and I grumbled that we had 2 very bad nights due to noise in the hotel and when traveling with young children having disturbed nights sleep isn't great. They put it right and offered us a return visit free of charge - wow what customer service. We love this hotel an would recommend everyone to it. Thanks again to  The Inn at Laguna - we will see you soon.
Manager Response: none
