Great customer service, amazing ocean views, perfect location to downtown Laguna Beach (as in within walking distance, steps from the hotel), comfortable beds, and I could go on. Gary, the manager, and his staff are personable and deliver an experience that you won't find at the chain hotels in the area. If you have children, the beach is right down the steps from the hotel. If you are traveling for business, the rooms are quiet and you'll have easy access to the PCH and 133. If you are looking for a romantic getaway, this is the spot....Las Brisas restaurant is right next door as well as romantic gems and spectacular shopping in downtown Laguna. And if you love milk and cookies at night along with complimenatry Starbucks coffee in the morning, they have
Manager Response: none

Summary: Charming hotel located right above the beach in Laguna.  Fabulous views and conveniently located within walking distance of restaurants and shopping.  The rooms are beautifully decorated in California beach chic.  The staff is friendly, engaging and efficient.  Ekaterina and bellman, Tyler were terrific.   My husband and I will definitely return to the Inn at Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location on the beach in Heisler Park
Summary: We truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and may make it an annual destination. It's located right on the beach within beautiful Heisler Park. We parked our car for the weekend in the hotel garage and were able to walk everywhere in town from this location. There is no shortage of great restaurants, shops, ice cream parlors and drinking establishments nearby. The hotel had a wonderful terrace facing the ocean that was equipped with a full bar, comfy furniture, heaters (if you needed them) and complimentary wine each evening from 5-6 p.m. for its guests. My husband and I loved relaxing on the terrace at sunset while enjoying a cocktail or glass of wine. I would definitely recommend spending the extra money for an ocean front room. Our room was on the street side of the hotel and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Before you shell out $400-500 per night for a room at this hotel, you should be very clear on what you are buying, which is a prime location right on the beach at Laguna.  The view from the balcony (and if you're going to stay here at all, you definitely want a room with a balcony, on an upper floor, overlooking the beach), is priceless.  Breathtaking sunsets, waking up to the waves rolling in, just gorgeous.  And the ability to step outside the hotel, right onto the path along the beach, for an early morning stroll, is also (almost) worth the money.  However....the rooms are nothing special.  On the small side, with a nondescript bathroom area.  (Actually, it had one of those set-ups that I hate, with the sink on the outside of the bathroom, so if you are an early riser and

Summary: This is a charming little Inn right on the beach in a fabulous location. The rooms are very nice and well maintained. Avoid the first floor if possible, the views are limited and the garage noise can be a problem. Great rooftop deck on the 4th floor, wonderful at sunset. No restaurant, but breakfast room service is available and morning coffee and tea are complementary.  There's also a pool. Very friendly and helpful service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: What can I say?  Just an amazing little hotel.  A perfect location (get a room on the water--it is worth the extra money), with amazing views of the beach, and the delight of the surf lulling you to sleep at night.  And so close to the heart of town.  We ate at a delightful different spot each night, and walked everywhere. The rooms and grounds are lovely.  Clean rooms, great beds, good TV, and comfortable chairs and sofas.  Right next to beautiful Heisler Park, where we began our walks each morning. The little things are nice, too, like the cookies and milk for the kids (old and young), the wine and snacks each evening, free papers and coffee in the morning, and even plenty of umbrellas when it (very) occasionally rains. But it is the staff that really shine.  Every one of

Summary: This hotel is stylish, clean and very nice.  It is conveniently located near Main Beach and affords beautiful views.  The staff was very nice and checked us in early.  Our room was beautiful and roomy.  The wine reception was a nice touch as was the offer of cookies.  The only negative was that the parking rate was outrageous.  We parked a few blocks away and walked because it was $35, which we thought was too steep.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We both grew up on the beaches of the OC and love to come up  from Diego when possible, this weekend was no exception. Service is kind but bit stuffy.thy did offer to let me enter an early.  Th room was quite lovely.  Very clean a bit smal but cozy. Open right onto the pool deck and steps from the warm Salt water pool. Decorated in a monochromatic white, the atmosphere was certaimnly calm. Wine reception served at dusk . Very very vice experience. However it was a suprised for my birthday Inn did nothing whatever to acknowledge it, to greeting, champagne, no cards, no flowers, no cake, zip ... Summary Heading: Beautiful location, clean rooms and friendly staff!
Summary: My husband, daughter and myself stayed here over the long holiday weekend for one night.  Annette was absolutely wonderful!  I had booked a room at a different hotel through another website and got an email 2 days later that the room was not available after all - so I called and spoke to Annette to see if I could possibly get a room at the Inn at Laguna Beach over the busy holiday weekend for the next night.  They had one room left and she was very accommodating and helpful.  She offered us a very good rate on such short notice, which i thought was very nice considering she could have charged us a lot more since the hotel was full that night! When we got there the staff was very nice and friendly.  We brought our small dog and he was welcome everywhere.  The hotel itself is in

Summary Heading: Location sells, but pricey for what you get
Summary: Stayed here for the long holiday weekend.  5 stars for location, 3 stars for the hotel itself.    ROOMS: The rooms are very small and could stand to be updated.  Ours faced the village--unlike some of the other reviewers, I didn't hear any street noise...however if you open the windows, it's quite loud.    LOCATION: You can't beat the location, right on the beach.  Right near the restaurants as well.    AMENITIES: The pool area was nice, although you may subjected to the sometimes tacky people who are there---there was a wedding party staying at the hotel who left a mess of beer bottles all around after they left---beer that they brought out there, BTW.  Not the hotel's fault, and I appreciate that you can bring your own stuff if you like.  The roof bar was nice with a great
Manager Response: none

Summary: Frankly, we were expecting a little more for the price. The room decor was little better than a Fairfield Inn or Holiday Inn.  It was dated, not renovated and a little musty smelling.  We had a sort of ocean view, no balcony, and the view was sideways to the ocean, with a metal awning below us that had garbage on it.    The rooms are small...beware of that.  And we were in the basement, which wasn't horrible, but not as nice as the above ground. The bathroom was updated and very nice. BEWARE: $35.00 a day parking charge. Exorbidant.  No where on their website nor at any booking site did it mention this.  If they are trying to hide it until you check in, then even they know it is ridiculous.  This left a poor taste in our mouth.   The location is awesome and central to Laguna

Summary Heading: Charming, comfortable, well managed boutique hotel
Summary: We stayed here recently, around the long holiday weekend. Rates were very high but with the gorgeous summer-like weather, it was worth every penny. We are typically somewhat budget-conscious and splurged a little bit for the holiday weekend. Another reviewer mentioned finding a rate for $200 which to me is an absolute steal for this place.  First, check-in was a breeze and management let us check in a few hours early. A 4pm check-in seems a bit late though, so it was much appreciated. They even called us to let us know when the room was ready. Our room was street facing, which was somewhat noisy from traffic during the day, but quiet in the evening. The doors are somewhat thin, and we were woken up one night from a person's roller suitcase and passing conversation around 2am. I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A Gem right on the Beach
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for one night to celebrate Our wedding Anniversary. We were completely wowed! We were upgraded to the most amazing room with views of the Ocean and Main beach. Brendan at the front desk really took care of us :)  Room was super clean and king size bed was super comfy .  We enjoyed the hotels perks, cookies and milk in the lobby everyday at 6 pm. The Wine tasting on the rooftop patio with stunning sunset views. And the Starbucks coffee in the lobby in the morning .   The location is perfect . Right on the Main Beach. Waking distance to many awesome restaraunts and shopping .  We couldn't have a better stay at the Inn! I would highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to come back one day!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful view, pricy for what you get
Summary: The view is breathtaking. The hotel is clean and renovated. The rooms are very small and basic. It is pricy for a non luxurious hotel. The turn off was the parking fee, $35 a night extra which is ridiculous. More ridiculous than that was the bottle of water in the room that was probably filled with tap water and it costs $7 :)))) unreal.  The nice part was that they serve complementary wine on the roof at the sunset which we missed. But I'm sure it is a good experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is right on main beach by a walkway.  We had room 107 which was perfect.  It was right on the beach and the stairs were right there to walk down to the beach.  All the doors were locked and you had to use a room key to get in, which made it very safe.  The rooms were a nice size and very clean.  There was a patio with a table and 2 chairs to people watch or just look at the ocean.  There was a wine reception every evening on the roof top deck which had great views and cookies and milk before bed in the lobby.   The pool was large and water was warm and there was a hot tub.  We could walk right to the middle of town, which was a short distance, and many restaurants and shops to chose from.  The staff was very accommodating.  I am so glad I chose this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, amazing views, fantastic staff
Summary: I traveled to Laguna Beach several times for business in 2014, and stayed here every time. I can only speak to the ocean view rooms, and I will say they are incredible. The size of the rooms are adequate, the bathrooms are nice, and the rooms have balconies with able and chairs.  Each evening, they have happy hour and cookies and milk.  The rooftop bar area is absolutely my favorite place to be when I am there. It has an amazing view of the ocean with comfy seating. It's a great place to get some work done or to relax with a book.  The staff is wonderful...friendly, accommodating, and always willing to recommend a place to eat or call for a taxi.   The location of the hotel is fantastic! When we were finished with our business meetings for the day, we could walk to a large
Manager Response: Dear Smlvaughan  Thank you for your comments regarding your recent visit to The Inn at Laguna Beach.  You touched on a couple of our greatest attributes our staff and our location.  Whether your stay is business or pleasure our staff wants to make sure all goes well and everyone leaves with a positive memory so I am very happy to see we did not disappoint.
