The hotel is walking distance from the shops and restaurants.  The pool and hot tub were well maintained.  This is a wonderful place to go for a romantic getaway.  I highly recommend Inn at Laguna.  They even have a wine reception and fresh baked cookies in the evening. We will be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband arranged for a birthday weekend get-away with our 10 and 12 year old kids to the Inn at Laguna, and we had a very good experience over all.  You can't beat the location as it sits on the cliff that overlooks Main Beach and the charming downtown area, and has 2 stairwells that lead directly down to the water.  We were in a poolside room, which was great for the kids to come and go out to the pool, but was closed one of the 2 days we were there (tho the weather was gray and cold so not ideal for swimming anyway!)  The room was clean, up-to-date, and well appointed and comfortable, and had 2 comfortable queen beds with nice linens, pillows and duvets.  We were next to the entry door which slammed closed out to the pool - so try and book a room on the higher levels to
Manager Response: none

Summary: A wonderful property  to return to  again  and   again. The Inn  captures the spirit of an earlier era in  California when life was less  rushed and  commercialized. Walking is the preferred  way to  visit the  many galleries and restaurants, park  your car and enjoy the slower pace of this romantic town. No ocean view  rooms were available but we found so  many locations on the property  that had scenic vistas that we never  felt deprived of the seaside experience. Very personable staff ,always  willing to answer any questions. The "wine hour" on  the veranda was a nice addition to our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at the Inn several times and each time we enjoy it more.  Ocean view rooms have lovely views of the Pacific.  The rooms are clean, decorated nicely in a beachy, casual style with overstuffed, comfortable beds. We enjoy the early morning room service with a pot of coffee, fruit and a pastry, while we sit on the balcony taking in the sights and smells of the ocean.
Manager Response: none

Summary: On a sunny Friday afternoon, after we had inched our way through heavy traffic to get to the Inn at Laguna Beach, we were dismayed to see that there was apparently no off street parking available. Having no other choice, we parked near the reception area, and were greeted by the bellman, who welcomed us to the hotel. One of the ladies serving at the front desk immediately went in search of a parking spot in one of the two underground parking lots, found a recently vacated one, and held it for us while we completed check-in. Needless to say, we were very grateful for her help.  We had splurged, by reserving a king sized room with an ocean view. This million dollar view was worth every penny. From the wall to wall windows, we could see down to the far end of the village and in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent 3 nights here in early April over spring break.  Friendly staff, and lovely rooms with very comfortable beds. Ocean view rooms are a premium but worth it. We saw dophins, seals and a whale during our stay!  Request top floor (5th) for best views.  North end of the property is the most quiet as there is a big construction project next to the south end of the property. No restaurant but a great evening wine hour on the terrace. Great restaurants within a few minutes walk and a Starbucks across the street. No valet parking and self parking is $29/night - for that price would expect valet particularly since the lot was occasionally full during our stay. All in all a wonderful property. Can't wait to come back to fall asleep to the crashing surf!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed in room 509- fantastic views and sea air. Close to everything. Small older facility that is well kept and has a lovely peacefulness (even with our two young kids). Pool is heated which was great as it is still a bit chilly this time of year. We will go back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for a much needed getaway trip
Summary: Let me start off by saying that my wife and I are parents of 4 year old twins, I own a business and she works so we rarely get time to take vacations.  As a result, we sorely needed to get away, even for a couple of days and Laguna Beach seemed like the perfect location to decompress.  I decided on this hotel because it was only about an hour from where we lived and was right on the beach (a stipulation of my wife.)  When i first contacted the hotel, the guy I talked to was very friendly and told me my options as far as the types of rooms they had and what would work best for what I was looking for.  He couldn't actually reserve a room for me since I called after midnight, but when I called back the next day they had my info. in the system and were able to reserve it quickly.
Manager Response: Dear novaj,  Thank you so much for your comments we ceratainly appreciate them.  I am happy to read that the staff was able to take care of your needs and accomdate your room request for your much needed get away.  Thank you for pointing out the psoitive items about your stay and noticing our renovation, as you may or may not know with a major renovation there are always things you wish you would of done or items that you wanted to do but for various reasons were unable to accomplish.  We are keeping comments so we know in our next renovation what should be addressed based on our guest feedback.    WiFi is an item that we have been addressing I could not agree more with you that we should have a good signal in every room.  This past quarter we have added new antennae's and access points to improve the WiFI signal but we still need to do more for certain rooms.  Please know we are addressing these areas.  The Ligeguard construction should be ever by this time next year and once it is complete not only will we have a state of the art Lifeguard facility but we will also have a multi-million dollar park.  The City should finish up the excavation this week and then they will start to pour concrete for a sub floor and walls.  The work changes each week and sometimes each day so it is hard for us to predict guest disruption.  The City of Laguna is very concerned about our guest so they are doing there best to limit the disruption and on occassion they have modified the operating hours.    We do hope to see you back at the Inn the next time you need to recharge your batteries.  Please look me up so I can give you a warm Laguna Beach welcome back.  Thank you  Peggy

Summary: Our family of four really enjoyed this hotel and the area. Staff were very friendly and helpful.   The Inn was very clean and relaxing.   If you want major relaxation and a prime location this is it!!   We will definitely be back in the future.
Manager Response: John Lahina  Thank you for your nice review and am really happy to read about your relaxing stay.  i am happy you touched on our location as we beleive it is the best in town.  Please come back and visit so we can give you a warm welcome back!!  Thank you Peggy

Summary: I love this hotel. It is extremely charming and in one of the best locations in Orange County. You are walking distance from everything that matters. Our favorite part was the dolphins that would come out and play every morning right in front of our balcony. The only downside to having a balcony is that the noise is a little loud from the street, but we found it worthwhile. I would definitely return to this hotel again for a 3rd time.
Manager Response: Dear JenHillJHCCS  Thank you for your kind review.  I wish that we could take credit for the dolphins but we cannot, but with our location you can sit and watch for the dolphins or you can take a stroll into the Village.    We truly apprecaite your loyalty and we are very happy you continue to retrun to the Inn, please look me up the next time you visit as I would love to personally welcome you to the Inn at Laguna Beach.  Thank you Peggy

Summary: What a gem! This is a spectacular hotel. I stayed for 1 night on business and found the staff to be warm, sincere, welcoming and always smiling. That’s says a lot about the culture. The rooms are wonderful, clean, fresh and comfortable. Rachel, Katie and Amour (spelling) at the front desk are a pleasure to be around.  You can hit the ocean with a rock it’s that close. The views are spectacular. You must go to the 4th floor terrace overlooking to ocean, incredible. I’ll definitely be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Their complimentary rooftop reception was a perfect start to our night in Laguna Beach. The shops and restaruants are an easy stroll away. Enjoyed dinner at Sundried Tomato Bistro on  cosy Forest Ave. The oceanview from the balcony is unforgettable - well worth the upgrade.
Manager Response: Dear Happy Travellers34  Thank you for your kind review.  Happy to hear you enjoyed a glass of wine on the Pacific Terrace and you are correct we are a short walk from many things.  Sun Dried Tomato is one of my favorites, I hope you tried the tomato soup.  I do hope to welcome you back to Laguna Beach soon please let me know if you are in the area  Thank you  Peggy

Summary Heading: A great stay right on the beach in southern California
Summary: My husband and I take a trip from Tucson to Laguna beach most summers.  We love to stay at the Inn at Laguna Beach.  The hotel is very nice, clean with updated decor.  They even allow small dogs.  They have a terrace that overlooks the busy beach  with lots of activity and the beautiful Pacific Ocean.  We purchase the package that includes breakfast and it is a healthy and filling meal, great coffee and OJ and you can eat it in your room or on the roof terrace.  Also, they have a wine happy hour each evening.  We just park and walk around the city of Laguna and while we visit there are many events..Pageant of the Masters, Sawgrass Festival and take a short drive to Newport and you'll have a great summer jazz concert under the stars at the Hyatt Newporter Hotel.  Lots of good
Manager Response: Dear Fijord1  Thank you for your kind review.  I hope to welcome you back to the Inn at Laguna Beach this August.  This year's theme for the Pageant is "The Big Picture" and I am sure it will not disappoint, I know I am looking forward to the event.  If you do not want to leave Laguna for Jazz we do have a summer concert series, but it is hard to beat Jazz under the stars in Newport.  Please look me up this summer as I would love to give you a warm Laguna Beach welcome.  Thank you Peggy

Summary: We stayed at the ILB based on a recommendation from a local. We paid the $29/night extra to upgrade and boy was it worth it. The room was right above the pool and we were able to sleep with the windows open and listen to the surf all night. The pool was warm, the staff was friendly, and we loved their wine tasting and cookies each night. We got great recommendations from the staff on where to eat and what to do. Centrally located, you can walk just about anywhere in LB and enjoy the great food and culture. We will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Dear Persephone C  Thank you for your kind review.  I am happy to hear you had a fabulous stay and even happier that you plan on returning.  We do have one of the highest walk scores (98) in Laguna so it is great that you commented on the easy access to the Village of Laguna and the fantastic restaurants.    Please look me up the next time you visit the Inn at Laguna Beach as I would love to give you a warm welcome back.  Thank you Peggy

Summary Heading: Clean, nice and comfortable rooms, friendly but bad breakfast
Summary: We stayed at this hotel last year and now 3 nights this year in the beginning of March. The hotel is clean, has a friendly atmosphere, nice and comfortable rooms with fantastic sea view. We saw dolphins and seals from our room! But unfortunately the WiFiwas very bad in our room and the breakfast should not be called a breakfast as it was just some sweet muffins and coffee. If you need Wifi then ask for a room with good WiFi when you book as they said that some rooms are better. There is a refrigerator and a coffee brewer in the room so just go to the excellent Whole foods market nearby the hotel and by your own. There is also an crganic very good restaurant (Nirvana) nearby the hotel. Go there!
Manager Response: Dear LadyredOrlando  Thank you for your comments we certainly apprecaite all comments both positive and negative as it only hleps us improve our product and service.  I thought you would like to know that we are in the process of upgarding our WiFi antennas in order to improve the WiFi service, we hope to have this complete within the next couple of weeks.  As for our breakfast offering we have been working with Las Brisas to develop a breakfast menu which we should be rolling out at the end of the month.  Our offerings will include various breakfast wraps along with other breakfast items.  I certainly hope that you will return to the Inn at Laguna Beach the next time you are in town to expreience some of our changes.  Please look me up on your next visit so I can welcome you back to the hotel.  Thank you Peggy

Summary: If hearing the ocean from your balcony is a slice of paradise, then this is the hotel for you! Loved the outdoor spaces, terraces, pool, etc. The views abound, whether the ocean of beautiful Laguna, this hotel is perfectly located. We parked the car and never used if for two days as everything is tight at your doostep.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place for a romantic weekend. Walk through the park or on the beach, or even shop within walking distance. Nice places to eat within walking distance also. Polite and helpful staff at check-in, but room was a bit small. See and hear the waves from your room. Stay on the ocean side.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Inn is perched atop a little sand cliff for wonderful views beyond the lovely pool, right next to the main beach and center of activity. In one direction, take steps right down to the beach. In the other direction, there's a sweet concrete walkway above the beaches that goes quite some ways, with wonderful art pieces, sculptures, and artistic benches along the way, lovely plantings, and beautiful views. Climb down at several points for further exploration.  Hotel staff were all wonderfully friendly and available, hotel parking was convenient, atmosphere and decor were bright, clean, and cheerful. I forget the particulars but there was some daily wine event by the pool? (we're not drinkers) and then a cookies and tea event that we definitely partook in -- yum!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here the last week in January.  The reservation specialist was extremely helpful and offered my husband a great rate.  We stayed in a room on the top floor with a  juliet balcony.  Check in was quick and the clerk was very friendly and helpful.  Our room was spacious with a king size bed, couch and fully stocked mini bar.  The room was very clean and the decor was contemporary.  The view was amazing and my husband and I settled in with a bottle of champagne to watch the sunset.  We had a wonderful time - thank you for a terrific, much needed getaway.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have traveled extensively and stayed in some beautiful hotels, and I can tell you that this is not a "luxury" resort.  I booked an ocean view King room.  Trip Advisor lists room service as one of the amenities, and there isn't even a restaurant on the property!  If you wonder why there are no photos of the bathrooms, either professional or traveler photos, it's because they are small, outdated, and have no bathtub.  Yes, the location is "right on the beach" except that there is a public walkway between it and your balcony, which was extremely busy the Sunday I was there.  Although the rooms were obviously updated, and the bed comfortable, the screen and sliding doors were stuck and one of the shutters fell off the track.  I could hear the people above and next to me walking,
Manager Response: I have reached out directly to Sweetsu318 regarding her stay at the Inn at Laguna Beach.  As she pointed out we have recently been through a renovation and we spent approximately $25,000 per bathroom.  Some of our rooms have stand up showers and some have a bath and shower combination, we were sorry we did not have her request for the combination.  Heisler Park is a wonderful destination for the City and it is full of Public Art we were sorry that Sweetsu318 was not able to experience its beauty but to only view it as a "busy pathway".  We have partnered with Las Brisas a Laguna Beach Icon to handle our room service needs, so it is correct we do not have a restaurant but we have a great partnership with Las Brisas.  I do hope Sweetsu318 will return to the Inn at Laguna Beach as now that we know the preferences we should be able to accomodate her needs.  We would love to give her a warm Laguna Beach welcome back.  Thank you Peggy

Summary: On my first get out of Vegas tour we decided to spend some time at Laguna Beach, and subsequently The Inn At Laguna Beach. I was very pleased that we did.  Location wide, hard to beat. A short walk down to the town/village of Laguna Beach, which really is one of the most delightful places I have been. The property is perched at one end of the beach on the headland and if you stay in the right room, you have a great view down the beach looking South. the ability to hear the ocean and see what's going on is a plus.  The rooms are 'warm' in terms of decor and it was really nice to see a property that understands that everyone does not necessarily want to sit on the bed! A nice three seater lounge suite and a club chair as well as 2 x Wicker chairs on the balcony gave us plenty of
Manager Response: Dear Im_a_travlin_fool  Thank you for your comments regarding your stay at the Inn at Laguna Beach.  All comments positive and negative are good for us as it helps us improve our prodects and service.  I am very happy to read that you enjoyed our location the most as we highlight our 98 walk score, our location is our best asset besides our staff.  I am sorry we were not able to move your room on your next visit we will be sure to place you on a higher floor.  Please look me up when you return to the Inn at Laguna Beach as I would love to give you a warm welcome back.  Thank you again Peggy

Summary Heading: Our new place to stay in Laguna Beach!
Summary: My husband and I were looking for a place for a relaxing anniversary getaway.  Laguna Beach is our favorite "staycation destination" and we had never stayed at Inn at Laguna Beach before so we thought we'd give it a try and we are THRILLED we did.  From the very first conversation with our reservation agent, Chuck, to the warm and welcoming greeting at the front desk by Deborah, we felt totally taken care of.  The Inn is perfectly located - just far enough away from main beach so it is quiet but close enough that it is only a 5 minute walk into town.  The balcony view of the ocean was TOTALLY worth the extra cost - as we sat and listened to the waves throughout our stay.  It was so relaxing and one of the nicest places we have ever stayed.
Manager Response: MiraS SanDiego  Thank you for your kind review, we appreciate all feedback both positive and neagative as it only helps us improve on our products and service.  I am thrilled that you mentioned the staff as they truly are the heart and soul of the hotel.    Thank you for mentioning our location besides our employees our location is one of our best attributes.  We love to talk about our 98 walk score and if you have a car you can leave it in the parking garage so we are happy that you agree with us.  I hope you will return before your next anniversary but if not we look forward to seeing you next year.  Please look me up upon your return as I would love to give you a warm Laguna Beach welcome.  Thank you Peggy

Summary: We found The Inn at Laguna Beach on a website and then checked out Tripadvisor reviews. The reviews do not do this keepstake enough justice. A boutique hotel on the ocean. We had a great ocen view and deck. The location is outstanding on the north end of the downtwon main beach. Attractively appointed with its recent remodel. Ownership is the same as The Biltmore in Phoenix so the ownership knows how to run a hotel. However the best part is their staff. John, a former golf teacher, could not be more attentive and accomodating. And Dorothy at the front desk "truly" takes a vested interest in your time at the hotel and in Laguna. Perfect no frills amenities. Yesterday, we read books on the terrace by the fire pit while watching and listing to the sounds of the ocean. Eveing
Manager Response: BarryZoob  Thank you so much for your kind review.  You touched on our two greatest resources our staff and our location.  I am very fortunate to come to work daily and be with such a great group of people.  They certainly make me a better leader and person.  We hope that you are able to return to Laguna Beach as we would love to give you a warm welcome back.  Thank you for the note you slipped under my office door.  Thank you Peggy

Summary: My husband and I have stayed here three times now for our anniversary. The first two times we were given a room with a private ocean view. This time we decided to pay extra for a balcony ocean view. Unfortunately, they put us on the first floor south side so instead of an ocean view, we got a noisy public walkway outside our room. The whole point of paying for the ocean view balcony is to enjoy the views, but we had to leave our doors/windows closed because it was not at all private and did not feel secure. We asked to be changed rooms, and the front desk worker (Anette, I believe) was not warm or understanding. She did show us a couple of other rooms, but they had worse views and were not any better or more secure feeling. She told us she would reduce our rate, but what I
Manager Response: Mrs. Tremblay  I am very sorry to read your review.  I knew you were having mechanical issues during your stay as both my Director of Engineering and Assistant General Manager discussed the AC unit.  I know we cannot change your past stay but please know we have since replaced the AC motor so the unit is operating as new.  At time of check out our Assistant General Manager addressed your issues and hopefully to your satisfaction.   Please know the safety and security of our guest is our nubmer one priority so I am sorry that you did not feel secure.  All of our rooms are a little different with different views and access but all are equally safe.  Mrs. Tremblay, I would like to repeat the offer from my Assistant General Manager, we hope you and your husband will return and give the Inn another opportunity to serve you on your anniversary.  Peggy

Summary: My husband, 6 year old daughter and I stayed at the Inn this past weekend and had a marvelous stay! We took full advantage of the heated pool...especially at night under the stars - :) And we really loved hearing and seeing the surf from our room.    The Inn is ideally located but what truly makes a place is the people. And we thank Rachel, Nour and Ekaterina for their special attention in making dinner reservations, suggesting activities, checking us in for our outbound flight and even trying to determine the price of a postcard stamp!  If you like cleanliness, friendliness, attention to detail and want to see/hear the ocean....then we highly recommend the Inn at Laguna Beach. Oh! Our 6 year old also wanted me to make sure I told you that she liked the cucumber water in the
Manager Response: Dear EABM9  Thank you for your kind review and for mentioning three of our great staff members Ekaterina, Nour and Rachel.  I am fortunate everyday to come to work with such a great group of poeple so I am happy that they made an impression on you and your family.  We are so happy you enjoyed the pool and our other amenities like the cucumber water, cider, and cookies.  We like to think we have something for everyone so we are glad your 6 year old agrees.  I do hope the next time you are in Laguna for a get away you will look me up as would love to welcome you back to the Inn at Laguna Beach.  Peggy

Summary: I was in southern California for work and i brought my wife down for a little R&R. We have teenage boys so she deserves a break from them! Anyway, I chose the Inn at Laguna Beach and we were not disappointed.   The location of the Inn is second to none. It is located right on the Pacific Ocean - the Pacific Coast Highway is to the East of us. You are only 3 blocks away from "downtown" Laguna Beach - with all of its quaint shops and restaurants. Laguna Beach is a great get away place which i highly recommend to anyone.  The Inn itself is small and casual. The King sized bed was super comfy and the wireless worked perfectly. We had a balcony over looking the Pacific Ocean and we heard the crashing waves all day and night. The front lobby service was excellent and so was the free
Manager Response: Dear Silverwoods  Thank you so much for your review, we welcome all comments as we want to improve our product and services.  We like to boost that we have the best walking score in Laguna Beach, at 98, so I am pleased you highlighted our location.    We hope you will visit Laguna Beach again as it is a great year round destination with differennt things to offer depending on the time of year.   The next time you are at the Inn please do look me up as I would love to give you a warm Laguna Beach welcome.  Thank you Peggy

Summary: First off - awesome location!  Though we rented a car for our weekend in Laguna Beach, the location of the Inn was fantastic.  It's near all kinds of shopping and restaurants and it's right on the beach.  We had a very nice, spacious King room with Ocean View Deck.  Terrific.  Yes, this is an older property, but I think the owners have done a really good job updating the rooms.  The front desk staff were very welcoming and helpful.  And the pool water was literally like bath water!  So nice :-)  The only two things I think could be improved is (a) having some kind of drinks service available while laying by the pool and (b) I think the room corridors are about ready to have new carpeting and possibly new wallcovering.  It's not terrible, but they don't look as good as the rooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The only good thing about this hotel was the view.  When we checked out on Sunday and got home I realized that I had left my make up mirror behind.  A very big make up mirror that spins and magnifys and lights up.  I called and left a message the very next day, and didn't hear back from anyone. I called again a week later and finally talked to the man in charge of house keeping.  Nothing was noted in their inventory, my mirror was just gone..... this mirror was big and bulky nothing you can just stick in your purse and walk away with.  I called and left a message for the general manager, when I didn't hear from her after a week, I called back and her excuse was "Oh I thought that the head of house keeping had taken care of this problem".....Really??? My mirror cost over $60, I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, great staff, right on the beach
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, our room faced the beach, it was clean and fresh, recently updated and had a perfect balcony with the perfect view of the beach.  We were within walking distance of art galleries, shops and many cafes, afew steps from the Laguna Art Museum, very close to everything the town has to offer. The hotel has no restaurant.  No free breakfast. Prepare yourself for hotel parking, which costs an additional $30 per day and if you want their Express Breakfast which consists of coffee and cold baking for two (nothing gluten free for my celiac husband) it will set you back $15.00! Our room faced the ocean so we paid a premium price, there is a pedestrian walkway between the notel and the beach but it was far enough away that it wasn't invasive.   I don't
Manager Response: Dear Roadrunnergo  Thank you for you review reagrading your recent stay.  Feedback is very important to the Hotel as it is a positive way to assess our guests needs,  I am sorry that we were not able to accomodate your husband who has celiac on this stay.  The next time you visit please let the Front Desk or Reservations know about your husbands condition and we will purchase a gluetin free muffin so you and your husband can enjoy coffee and muffins on the balcony over looking the Pacific Ocean.  Thank you again for you review please look me up the next time you stay at the Inn at Laguna Beach as I would love to welcome you back!

Summary Heading: Sleep to the sound of waves crashing!
Summary: I live in another part of California, 3 blocks from the beach and hear the surf every night.  My room at the Inn was almost on the beach and the sound of the waves from that close was like a lullaby!  My room (412) had a terrific view of the ocean, some rocks and the coast.  Price was very reasonable (it was mid-week, January).  The room was comfortable and bathroom spacious.  I'd definitely go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A wonderfully updated hotel that has perhaps the ultimate location in Laguan Beach.  While some of the other hotels in the area match some of the exceptional services, no one is right in the heart of Laguna Beach and city. Everything you need to see, every restaurant, all are just minutes away by walking.  The room was very nice and the view...spectacular! The roof top bar with their free wine tasting at sunset was unbelievable.  The hotel does not have a full service restaurant; however, there are literally 15 excellent choices from various price ranges within a 10 minute walk of the hotel.  One is only 50 feet away.  They gave us a nice surprise for our anniversary.  The staff were great.  We will definately stay here again.  Almost didn't want to list this one because we want
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I want to live this way!
Summary: From entry into the lobby to service, to parking and comfort all-around, this is an amazing value.  I feel my entire stay was like a fine massage for my senses.  A perfect location from the 'heart' of Laguna Beach to walk or bike.  I loved that the hotel parking was entirely free.  I was made to feel at home, only better our entire stay.
Manager Response: Dear Myraleb  Thank you for your wonderful comments.  I am very happy that your senses got a massage, that is something we all need from time to time. We want all of our guest to feel like this is there home away from home and in your case we accomplished our goal.  The next time you stay at the Inn at Laguna Beach, please look me up as I would love to give you a warm Laguna Beach welcome back.  Thank you again we look forward to seeing you in the future Peggy

Summary: The Inn At Laguna Beach is a great way to relax and enjoy gorgeous Laguna Beach all year round. We visited in the winter. Unique shops, art galleries and restaurants, all in walking distance. Every meal was delicious.  We enjoyed the little extras such as fresh brewed coffee in the morning, hot cookies at night, and the wine reception on the lovely terrace in the evening. We didn't know the pool was heated, so next time we'll bring suits.
Manager Response: Dear Monica A  Thank you for your nice comments regarding your recent stay at the Inn at Laguna Beach.  You summed up all of the great reasons people enjoy living here as well as visiting.    Please bring your swimsuit as not only is our pool heated but we also have a nice SPA for those cool evenings.    Please look me up the next time you viist the Inn at Laguna Beach as I would love to give you a warm Laguna Beach welcome.  Thank you Peggy

Summary: My wife ( who is handicapped/disabled) and I stayed for 16 nights including the Christmas period. As the average stay by Americans is under a week this was a long stay by comparison.The Hotel was excellent as were the staff. This is a UK standard 4 star hotel but without a restaurant or bar. This was not a problem however as there are numerous bars and restaurants a short walk away.Our package included a continental breakfast and as we were staying for 16 breakfasts we asked that the "menu" was mixed up a little to give us more variety. This was not a problem to the Hotel who did everything possible to make our stay as comfortable as possible.Breakfast was served to the room and always on time,coffee was available from reception from early morning. We stayed in room 420 which
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel with equally amazing people.
Summary: My wife and I stay at the Inn at Laguna at least twice a year.  This year we stayed over Christmas and had the best time ever.  The newly remodeled hotel is wonderful.  The best part of the stay was the courteous and knowledgable staff.  Every person we spoke to was polite and willing to answer our questions.  We are looking forward to our next trip.
Manager Response: Michael C  Thank you for your kind comments regarding the renovation but more importantly the staff.  I feel very fortunate to come to work each day and work with this amazing group of people.  We pride ourselves on our location and the service our staff provides.  I am grateful that you have noticed the change from your previous stays and we look forward to welcoming you back upon your return to Laguna Beach.  Please look me up on your next visit as I would love to welcome you back!!!  Thank you  Peggy

Summary: An excellent hotel with gorgeous sea views. Staff are very friendly and professional, the rooms and beds are very comfortable. The location is perfect just a short walk along the beach from the restaurants in town. The daily complementary wine and cookie reception is a nice touch. Only thing missing for me was a bar and snack service at the pool. Highly recommend this place for quiet relaxing getaway..
Manager Response: Dear RodJBcn  Thank you very much for your positive review and highlighting our laocation and our staff, two things we pride ourselves on.  We are certainly looking at ways to improve and one of the items we are discussing for 2013 is to add a bar to our 4th Floor Terrace for hotel guest and there guests.  This being said we would be able to deliver to the pool area as well.  It is my hope the next time you visit we will have implemented this change.  Thank you very much for your review, I hope you and your family have a wonderful holiday and we wish you all the best in the New Year  Peggy

Summary Heading: Right on the beach, you can't beat the location
Summary: Excellent location for a stay in Laguna Beach. Just up the stairs from the main beach and a very short walk to Las Brisas Mexican Food Restaurant. The room with a balcony was a perfect place to enjoy the sunset with some wine and cheese. Highly recommend this cozy little hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at the Inn At Laguna Beach several times a year during the last 5+ years primarily due to its amazing location in Laguna Beach and just tolerated the dated rooms.  We just stayed there the weekend of Dec 1st, and what a huge difference a remodel makes.  The tacky furniture has been replaced with contemporary nice furniture.  The bathrooms now how have granite counters, and the icky shower curtain has now been replaced with a REAL shower door!  All of the rooms have been completely redone, from the carpet and paint, to the furniture, linens and amenities.  GREAT IMPROVEMENT!!!!!  And now worth the room rate.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed in the room with ocean view -rather cute, but really expensive. In the evening they offered complimentary wine, pool is rather good. Bad thing - large construction site just next to the hotel - spoils everything. Continental breakfast in the room - $25 for pastries and coffee.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed in room 425.  Very small with even smaller balcony. Actually you really could not use the balcony it was so small but it looked cute.  However, paying more than $300 a night is not cute.  The room had just been refurbished and the view of the ocean was nice but not the best but ok. This really what you are paying for. Parking is $29.00 extra.  There is a coffee maker in the room and the bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly.  Overall very nice place and great location.
Manager Response: Fredwilo  Thank you for your comments we certainly appreciate them as we do our best to make sure our guests are happy.  In June we completed a multi-million dollar renovation of the guest rooms, pool, pool deck and the fourth floor terrace; however, we did not get to much of the public space.  I was thankful you commented on one of our best attributes which is location, nestled between Main Beach and Las Brisas with a short walk to the village.  I am happy to hear you will be back please look me up on your next visit so I can give you a warm Laguna Beach welcome back.  Thank you Peggy

Summary Heading: Great location in a Great place
Summary: Stayed in a room overlooking the bay and had a great time.  The fact that we go mid-80s weather in November helped.  Slightly dated rooms and facilities -- seemed like some areas were in need of a facelift (and no workout facility).  But excellent location on the beach, near downtown, next to Las Brisas, etc.  Will be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Last night in California and needed a room for the night. Liked the look of the outside of the Inn and the great location. We decided to check it out and were delighted about our room! They had thought of everything. The furniture and decor were stylish and comfortable, robes, mini-bar, coffee pot, etc. etc.! Were so sad we could not stay longer, but if we go back we will definitely stay there!
Manager Response: Laura H  Thank you for your comments, we are sorry you were only able to stay one night, we hope you return for a longer visit.  In June we completed a multi-million dollar renovation so I am happy to hear that we thought of everything.  Thank you as well for commenting on the location, we are 84 steps to the beach and a couple of blocks from the Village.  I hope the next time you stay at the hotel you will look me up so I can give you a warm Laguna Beach Welcome  Thank you Peggy

Summary Heading: A hotel that keeps it simple....
Summary: Stayed for four nights in November in a sea view room, they do have rooms facing the pool and inland.  The hotel has a great location overlooking Laguna Beach and within a few mins walking distance on the town centre which has a great selection of restaurants, bars, local and independent stores.   Facilities at the hotel are limited, there is no bar or restaurant but it doesn't matter, the service, location, quality of rooms and their set up more than compensate. This isn't your corporate hotel so don't expect any of the mundane aspects you find at the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice hotel, great price & wonderful location ! The view of the Ocean & park was great . There is a very nice balcony with tables to sit on. Loved having the stocked refrigerator, flat screen tv & comfortable bed. Within walking distance of cute shops & restaurants .
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a Sibling Reunion of five from three states at the Inn at Laguna Beach for three nights.  The Inn is located right on the ocean adjacent to the main Laguna Beach Park to the south and Heisler Park to the north.  Heisler Park has a wonderful walk along the ocean cliffs, great photo shots.  Twenty minutes from Orange County John Wayne Airport.  The three sisters took two adjoining rooms (only one available, non-ocean side) together and the two brothers a balcony room over looking the ocean.  The staff was very good, friendly, and took pictures of the five of us.  We had one small maintenance issue that was fixed in one hour.  Parking for guests is lower level under the Inn.  Parking is $29 per night with plenty of spaces.  The location of the Inn is excellent with walking
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms at the inn are wonderfully modern and spacious, and the views overlooking the bay just gorgeous. The only downside we experienced was that the fire alarm went off three times in 24 hrs, incl. in the middle of the night. No fun! The location is great and very close to the heart of town--but the rooms can be a bit noisy, being next to Highway # 1 and the construction next door. Definitely recommendable if you get a deal.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lovely inn right on the beach
Summary: We spent two nights in Laguna Beach during a week long southern California vacation.  We love Laguna Beach, but this is the first time we've actually stayed right in town.  The location of the Inn couldn't be better - we simply walked out of the hotel and onto the footpath along the beach.  The lovely terrace on the 4th floor was my favorite spot for enjoying the crashing surf without getting too sandy!  It had ample seating (even during the popular wine hour), a fire pit, heaters and great views of the ocean.  We booked at the very last minute, and thus didn't have the greatest room (if you were tall enough, one window had an ocean view, but if you're short like me, that view was of a large AC unit - so we had to keep the blinds closed).  The Inn is just a short walk from the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were visiting our son in LA and wanted a quick relaxing getaway to spend some quality time together as a family. The hotel was comfortable and relaxing. I was surprised at how quiet it was in our room as the hotel was fully booked. Although the room that our son had was considered a "village" room, all he had to do was walk outside his door to a small patio that was a partial ocean view and could even hear the waves with his window open. Also, the hotel was right in the heart of Laguna Beach's downtown area full of shops, restaurants and art galleries.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: If you want someplace special, this is the place!
Summary: It was our 3 year anniversary and I wanted to make it very special. I researched hotels in the area and really liked what I saw on the web site.  I wanted something unique, very clean, close but not noisy and enjoy the beach. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Each time we saw them, they always had smiles. It was difficult to leave but my wife turned to me and said that we will be back.  I would give the experience a 12 on a scale of 1-10!.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were really nice and fairly large.  The staff was helpful, kind and professional.  They had beach chairs and umbrellas for the beach which was just down the steps.  You can easily walk to shops and restaurants. They also had a free wine happy hour and a cookies and cider hour.  We would stay there again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The minute we drove up to the front of the inn I knew that we would NOT be disappointed.  The inn is well situated on Laguna Beach and within walking distance to the downtown area and many restaurants.  The rooms were beautiful with great views of the ocean.  Nice wine tasting in the lobby nightly, heated outdoor pool, and a balcony that is perfect for watching the sunset or taking in the stars in the evening.  Check out the hiking at Crystal Cove Reserve, Capain Dave's Whale and Dolphin Safari, Museum of Contempary (next door).  Sapphire Restaurant, Watermarc, and 230 Forest are excellent restaurants for foodies and just a few steps from the inn is Las Brisas!  What's not to love.  We'll be back!
Manager Response: Carol S  I am so happy to read that you will be back, although form the sounds of it you accomplished a lot on your vacation Laguna Beach still has much more to offer.  The Restaurants you named are fantastic and you have just scratched the surface.  We are very fortunate to have Las Brisas next door and more fortunate that are room service comes out of their kitchen.  I do hope to meet you on your next visit  Thank you Peggy

Summary Heading: You'll love the view, and the rooms are good too.
Summary: Hotel sits right above Main Beach and next to Las Brisas. Beautiful spot for sea and sunset views. Be sure to ask for an ocean view room with a balcony, high floor, not on the Coast Highway side of the building but on the ocean side. Then, you'll enjoy the view and the room too. Beds are comfortable, furnishings are California contemporary. It's not ultra-luxury, but very very nice - and you can't beat the location. Front desk and household staff were friendly and helpful. Very pleasant weekend stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wish it was more than one night!
Summary: We truly needed the beauty and comfort of this property on our trip down route 1. Definitely get a beach view but if for some reason you don't, enjoy the beautiful view at their bar. Beds and linens were divine. Bright and airy room!. Staff at front desk were exceptional. They have stopped the continental breakfast but grab your wake up coffee (an excellent Starbucks roast) and then head down the street to "Cottages" to enjoy a nice breakfast in a historic home landmark. It also has outdoor seating. Only negative was the expensive parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel in the heart of Laguna
Summary: The Inn at Laguna Beach was the perfect hotel for our family vacation. With its proximity to the beach as well as downtown Laguna, everything was a breeze. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating---loaning us beach chairs and sand toys as well as offering complimentary wine tastings and cookies every evening. The rooms were bright and clean, and the views are breathtaking.  I highly recommend this hotel for a great family getaway.
Manager Response: Kristin D  Thank you for your kind comments regarding your last visit.  We are very happy you and your family had a nice time and were able to enjoy the beaches of Laguna.  It is great you were able to take advantage of some our complimentary amenities; such as, the beach chairs and wine hour.  Please let me know the next time you return to Laguna Beach as I would love to give you and your family a warm welcome back.  Thank you Peggy

Summary: My husband and I spent one night here, it was beautiful. The staff is very friendly and helpful, NOUR at the front desk was very welcoming, helpful and made us feel right at home. The hotel is at a prime location in Laguna Beach and very convent for walking around shops and restaurants. NOUR also provided us with information on all the services they offer and the different things we could do in the area. It was a great place to go to!
Manager Response: Nancy D  Thank you for your kind comments and for recognizing the efforts of our staff and in particular Nour.  She is a wonderful asset for our team and we are lucky to have her so I appreciate you taking the time to single her out.  We hope to have you back soon so you can experience more of Laguna Beach, in October we have the Plein Air Painting Invitational and in March we have a big food and wine event "Uncorked" both worhty of a trip to Laguna.  I would love to meet you on your next visit.  Thank you Peggy

Summary: My wife and I spent the last weekend at the Inn at Laguna Beach....it would be a true challenge to sufficiently describe just how perfect this place is.  The hotel is positioned right on the best section of Laguna's beaches - away from all of the noise however just a two minute walk into the heart of downtown.  The room was fantastic, by far exceeding our expectations.  Very clean and comfortable bedding, gorgeous views of the beach and sunsets, and lots of space within the room.  The staff were perfect....always available to help and full of great suggestions.  Not only is this place an incredible value, I would hold it up to any of the hotels in the Laguna and Newport areas.  You won't find a better opportunity to stay in a top-notch hotel located directly on the beach in all
Manager Response: BD  Thank you for your wonderful review of the property.  We would agree that our location is perfect, as there is no need to get in your car once you have arrived.  Our staff does all that they can to exceed expectations so I am happy to read that they took care of your every need.  I do hope you and your wife return to Laguna Beach soon as I would love to welcome you back to the Inn at Laguna Beach  Thank you Peggy

Summary: Great hotel! We had a great view & heard the ocean all night.  The staff was great & helpful, they provide great umbrellas, towels & chairs for the beach.  You can walk everywhere. Modern rooms very boutique luxury. Also the terrace is amazing with couches and amazing views.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Direct at the beach but also direct at the highway
Summary: Make sure that you´ll get a room at the beachside of the hotel. on the street side it is really loud because the highway is only a view yards away. the hotel itself is nice,modern,clean and has a certain california beach atmosphere.  The pool is ok and the also have well heated jacuzzi.  All rates include breakfast wich comes to your room or to the roof terasse. Coffe you have to brew yourself in the room or to buy at vis avis starbucks.  The beach infront of the hotel is really nice but hasn´t any facillities beside a shower. At the hotel you can get an umbrella and some tiny beachchairs to make your beachlife more comfortable. Parking is also free. Summarized it is a good hotel if you´re on the beachside
Manager Response: Dear Reisebein  Thank you for your comments regarding your recent visit to the Inn at Laguna Beach.  It is true we are nestled atop the bluff between the Pacific Ocean and Pacific Coast Highway but this is not unusual for the hotels in Laguna.  More than half of our rooms do face the ocean as this is the preferred view.  We are no longer delivering complimentary continental breakfast; however, for a small charge we have an upgraded coffee service with fresh baked goods to be delivered to your room.  With our location we have over 40 fabulous restaurants that are all within walking distance that serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner.    Thank you again for your comments Peggy

Summary: I stayed at this hotel in June and had a great experience whilst indulging in a sea view suite- waking up to the sound of waves every morning was pure vacation perfection. While back in the area in early September, I could't help but indulge once again. Booking a sea view suite for two nights- i could hardly wait. The following day i received a phone call to say our room  had been double booked so we could only have the sea view for the second night. I was a little disappointed as the village view rooms are quite small and of course lacking the beautiful private balcony with sea view. When we arrived, the hotel was accommodating and offered to move our luggage the following day as soon as our sea view room was available and they tried make us as comfortable as they could. After
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were delighted with our experience at the Inn at Laguna Beach. We had taken the advice ofother tripadvisors and booked an Ocean-facing room and were not disappointed. This Inn provides excellent service, value for money and great little extras (e.g. glass of wine in the evening; body boards; beach deck chairs). We felt extremely welcome and the service was friendly and unpretentious at all times yet still first class. I cannot recommend this place highly enough. I doubt that I'll be lucky enough to be able to return there in the near future but would return again at the drop of a hat should the opportunity arise.
Manager Response: Dear HH  I am sorry to read that you will not be able to return to Laguna Beach in the near future as we would love to have you back to see more of our little City.  Thank you for pointing out all of  the little extras, we certainly do what we can to make each stay enjoyable and memorable.  I do hope you try to make time to visit again as I would love to welcome you back  Peggy

Summary: This is a great hotel, with nice spacious rooms in a great location, on a fabulous beach, in a really nice town. But if you pay extra for the Ocean View, don't get stuck in room 101 like us, you'll be very disappointed. Yes you can see the ocean, if you lean out the balcony and look left. In a court of law I'm sure it could be proven that the room has an ocean view. But boy were we deflated when we saw it. At least we could still hear the sound of the ocean. Would still recommend this hotel. Staff are great.
Manager Response: Dear Irish TravellerMF  Thank you for your comments regarding your recent visit.  I am so sorry you did not like the view from your room.  Each room is a little different with slight variation on views, the next time you are with us we will note your preferences and do our very best to exceed your expectations.  I am happy to read that you would recommend the hotel and that the staff was great as we pride ourselves on our guest service.  Thank you again for your comments I certainly hope you return to Laguna Beach and the Inn at Laguna Beach as I would love to welcome you back  Peggy

Summary: We were so happy that we chose this hotel.  The location was awesome!  Right next to the beach.  We kept our door open so we could hear the waves!  The hotel was very clean and they have a very friendly staff.  Also, the breakfast was good.  Hope to return some day!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location is amazing!  Listen to the ocean at night, walk to all the best restaurants and shops in town.  Service with a smile and breakfast in your room, plus having Laguna Beach (beach) right at your front door to walk along the ocean or take a quick swim is fantastic, what more could you ask for.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was immaculate!!! The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable! I loved the little touches like a handwritten letter welcoming us and cookies and lemonade!  The location was just steps away from the gorgeous beach! We loved the balcony facing the water. We fell asleep hearing the waves roll in! The Inn was in walking distance of many wonderful restaurants and shops! This was truly the most peaceful and relaxing vacation that I have been on in a long time!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments and noticing the details.  We love our location as you pointed out steps from the beach and we are also walking distance to the Village of Laguna Beach and the Festival Grounds.  I hope on your next visit you will get a chance to look me up as I would love to welcome you back to the Inn at Laguna Beach.  Thank you, for staying with us and I hope to see you in the near future Peggy
